girl with her Playboy heir husband Cooper. </p>\n<p>Businessman Cooper, 28, announced their exciting news on social media and revealed they have called their daughter Betsy Rose. </p>\n<p><figure Monday[/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491403\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 398px\"><img width=\"768\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Instagram</figcredit></figure>Playboy heir Cooper announced the news on social media[/caption]</p>\n<p>He also shared several snaps of Scarlett, 29, cradling Betsy while sitting in her hospital bed and one of the tot laying swaddled in a blanket. </p>\n<p>Cooper wrote on Instagram: &#8220;At 5:23pm this afternoon Scarlett and I welcomed our daughter Betsy Rose Hefner into the world. </p>\n<p>&#8220;We are overwhelmed with gratitude, love and joy.&#8221;</p>\n<p>The couple have been inundated with well-wishes from their showbiz pals and fans. </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491405\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 338px\"><img Wilkinson, a previous girlfriend of Cooper&#8217;s dad Hugh, gushed: &#8220;Congrats to you all. She’s beautiful. welcome to the world Betsy!! <img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/1f60d.png\" alt=\"😍\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/2764.png\" alt=\"❤\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" />.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Actress Tessa Netting added: &#8220;OH MY GOSH!!! CONGRATS AHHHHH LOOK AT THAT LITTLE ONE!!!&#8221;</p>\n<p>Scarlett, who played Pansy Parkinson in the Harry Potter movie series, announced her pregnancy back in March. </p>\n<p>Alongside a bump photo, she said: &#8220;Cooper and I are delighted to share that we have a little one on the way.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491406\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 778px\"><img 0f147674.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584742},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Spar recalls chicken and prawn paella over fears it could cause allergic reactions","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12491178/spar-paella-chicken-prawn-recall/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>SPAR has recalled its own-brand frozen chicken and prawn paella over fears it could cause allergic reactions.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The convenience store chain says the product contains mollusc, fish, gluten and milk which isn’t declared on the label.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491191\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 522px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/SPAR.png?strip=all&#38;w=512\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491191\" width=\"512\" height=\"526\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Spar has pulled its chicken and prawn paella from shelves</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>This means the paella could be a possible health risk to anyone with an allergy or food intolerance to these ingredients.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>People who are severely allergic to molluscs or fish can experience anaphylactic shock, while an intolerance to milk and gluten can cause digestive issues such as stomach cramps.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Spar advises anyone with an allergy to these foods to return the paella to their nearest store for a full refund.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>You can find your nearest Spar shop by using its <a href=\"https://www.spar.co.uk/store-locator\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">online store locator tool</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Which Spar product has been recalled?</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<p class=\"article__content--intro\">\n\t\t\t\t\tSPAR has recalled its frozen chicken and prawn paella - here&#039;s everything you need to know about the affected batch.\t\t\t\t</p>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p>You can find this information on the back of the pack.</p>\n<p><strong>Pack size:</strong> 600g</p>\n<p><strong>Best before:</strong> 13 October, 2021, inclusive</p>\n<p><strong>Barcode:</strong> 5010358010564</p>\n<p><strong>Lot number: </strong>0105</p>\n<p><strong>Allergens: </strong>Fish, gluten (wheat), milk, molluscs</p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>You can also contact Spar on 0333 880 5115 or by filling out this <a href=\"https://www.spar.co.uk/contact-us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">online form</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The chicken and prawn paella costs £2.50 and comes in a 600g bag.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The recalled batch has a best before date of October 13, 2021, inclusive and the barcode number 5010358010564.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>You can find this information on the back of the paella pack.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Your product recall rights</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<p class=\"article__content--intro\">\n\t\t\t\t\tPRODUCT recalls are an important means of protecting consumers from dangerous goods.\t\t\t\t</p>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p>As a general rule, if a recall involves a branded product, the manufacturer would usually have lead responsibility for the recall action.</p>\n<p>But it&#8217;s often left up to supermarkets to notify customers when products could put them at risk.</p>\n<p>If you are concerned about the safety of a product you own, always check the manufacturer’s website to see if a safety notice has been issued.</p>\n<p>When it comes to appliances, rather than just food items, the onus is usually on you &#8211; the customer &#8211; to register the appliance with the manufacturer as if you don&#8217;t there is no way of contacting you to tell you about a fault.</p>\n<p>If you become aware that an item you own has been recalled or has any safety noticed issued against it, make sure you follow the instructions given to you by the manufacturer.</p>\n<p>They should usually provide you with more information and a contact number on its safety notice.</p>\n<p>In some cases, the manufacturer might ask you to return the item for a full refund or arrange for the faulty product to be collected.</p>\n<p>You should not be charged for any recall work &#8211; such as a repair, replacement or collection of the recalled item.</p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Spar has recalled the paella as a precautionary measure &#8211; it hasn’t reported any illnesses from this product.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>No other Spar products are affected by the recall.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A notice on the <a href=\"https://www.food.gov.uk/news-alerts/alert/fsa-aa-46-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">Food Standards Agency</a> website reads: &#8220;Spar is recalling Spar Chicken and Prawn paella because it contains fish, molluscs, milk and wheat (gluten), which are not mentioned on the label. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;This means the product is a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to fish, and/or molluscs, and/or an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents, and/or to wheat (gluten).&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Sun has contacted Spar for more information and we&#8217;ll update this article when we get a response.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-money\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">Most read in -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Other recalls to watch out for include these <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12476473/eat-natural-recall-bars-salmonella/\">Eat Natural bars which have been pulled from shelves</a> over fears they may contain traces of salmonella.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12368292/sainsburys-issues-urgent-recall-for-milk-product/\">Sainsbury’s has also pulled its UHT milk</a> over &#8220;possible microbiological bacteria contamination&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12190596/john-lewis-recall-cot-mattresses/\">John Lewis has recalled this mattress</a>&#160;over fears it&#8217;s unsafe for babies.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/SPAR.png?strip=all&w=512","linkMd5":"239de7f28aa72d3ced57752ba9a45b26","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-26-954_dfb627ea21bed646.webp","destWidth":512,"destHeight":526,"sourceBytes":94718,"destBytes":94718,"author":"Levi Winchester","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/SPAR.png?strip=all&w=512":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-26-954_dfb627ea21bed646.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584740},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Pubs could be ordered to SHUT in Birmingham as lockdown rules tightened to stop spread","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/politics/12492772/pubs-could-be-ordered-to-shut-birmingham/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>PUBS could be ordered to SHUT in Birmingham from Wednesday as lockdown rules are tightened to stop the spread of coronavirus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The City Council today revealed tough new powers to try and stop the city from going into a full lockdown.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"⚠\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &#38; updates</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12452808\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 680px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Birmingham.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=670\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12452808\" width=\"670\" height=\"439\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Police will have new powers to shut pubs and restaurants which aren&#8217;t coronavirus-secure in Birmingham</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>It means police will be able to stop people going in restaurants or bars which aren&#8217;t covid-secure.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And some large events such as weddings and funerals could be cancelled too.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Cops will also have the power to close public outdoor spaces to stop people gatehring there too.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The measures are partly to stop the spread of the virus so that schools don&#8217;t have to shut and kids&#8217; education won&#8217;t be harmed any further, leaders said today.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It comes after a Gold Command meeting with Matt Hancock and local leaders in Birmingham last week.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The city became an &#8220;area of concern&#8221; and will now become an &#8220;area of enhanced support&#8221; after a spike in cases.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, today it was claimed that rates of infection have been going down over recent days.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The news also comes as cops broke up SEVENTY illegal parties in Brum last weekend <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/uknews/12476595/rave-police-huddersfield-birmingham-party-local-lockdown/\">despite the threat of tighter measures.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police across the UK<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/politics/12440914/ravers-face-huge-fines-illegal-parties/\"> now have the power to slap ravers with £10,000 fines for hosting illegal parties</a> too.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Councillor Ian Ward, Leader of Birmingham City Council said today: “While the recent figures show our rates are going down, we cannot be complacent.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We must all continue to follow all the relevant safety guidance in order to protect our families, friends and work colleagues. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Most importantly staying disciplined now is a price worth paying when compared to the cost of damaging the future life chances of our City’s children – which may happen if there is a spike in the rate of infections and schools have to close, or parents do not send them due to concerns about the potential risks . </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Whilst the impact of Covid-19 may be felt over the next few years, the negative impacts upon children not being present at school will last a lifetime.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The new powers mean cops will be able to intervene to keep citizens safe and stop them from spreading the infection.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Members of the public can let the council or police aware of any concerns they have by ringing a special hotline or filling in a form online.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Offending businesses will be issued with written warnings and served with a closure of notice if they refuse to comply.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The current rules for pubs and other hospitality venues include:</p>\n\n\n\n<ul><li>Customers must give their details to the venue so track and trace can alert them if there&#8217;s a potential case</li><li>No more than six people from a max of two households should be meeting up</li><li>People must stay apart from other groups</li><li>Wearing a face covering where required &#8211; unless eating or drinking in</li></ul>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-news\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">Most read in Politics</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-wrapper\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a moment man is sent somersaulting over hedge by &#039;road rage driver&#039;\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12484271/man-sent-flying-hedge-road-rage-driver/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 10:36:53 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png","linkMd5":"d7fbe2698664f11f251318ff6ea6c698","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn70@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-259_8c2ee998bba5b6ed.webp","destWidth":72,"destHeight":72,"sourceBytes":595,"destBytes":1080,"author":"Natasha Clark","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn70@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-259_8c2ee998bba5b6ed.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Birmingham.jpg?strip=all&w=670":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn39@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-30-666_28bab4ff51fb3cb1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584674},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Tragic Brit Nora Quoirin, 15, ‘couldn’t walk 20ft on her own & had no cuts on feet’ – but cops say she wasn’t kidnapped","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491162/nora-quoirin-no-cuts-feet-jungle-inquest/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>BRIT teenager Nora Quoirin had no cuts or scars on her feet despite cops saying she wasn&#8217;t kidnapped, an inquest was told.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The body of the 15-year-old <a href=\"https://www.thesun.ie/news/4436105/nora-quoirin-search-body-found-unclothed-resembles-teen/\">was found in a Malaysian rainforest ten days after she was reported missing</a> on the family&#8217;s trip of a lifetime.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491431\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603138614-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491431\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AFP</figcredit></figure>Nora, 15, was found dead ten days after she went missing[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491548\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603690871-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491548\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AP:Associated Press</figcredit></figure>Cops say she wandered into the rainforest alone[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>During yesterday&#8217;s inquest, a lawyer representing the Quoirin family highlighted that Nora, who wasn’t wearing shoes when she went missing, had no injuries to her feet despite being found one kilometre away from the villa.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“She was found unclothed, without footwear yet there were no serious scars or injuries to her soles?” the lawyer said.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>According to Nora&#8217;s parents, the teenager could not walk 20ft on her own, <a href=\"https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/nora-quoirin-teen-found-dead-22573429\">The Mirror</a> reports.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mohamad Nor Marzukee Besar, the police superintendent who covers the Dusun Resort district said: &#8220;A preliminary interview with Nora Anne&#8217;s family led us to conclude due to the victim&#8217;s special condition, she was not able to go beyond 20ft on foot when on her own.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mohamad Mat Yusop, the local police chief, was the first witness to be called to the inquest in Seremban.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mr Yusop agreed with the family’s lawyer and said that Nora had &#8220;only some minor bruises&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, Mr Yusop added: “There was no indication the victim was kidnapped.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“We did not receive any telephone calls &#8211; usually in this kind of case we will get a call to say the victim has been kidnapped and is in the hands of certain people, and they would demand a ransom.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I believe the missing person actually climbed out of the window.”</p>\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/nora-map.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=567\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491625\" width=\"567\" height=\"960\" />\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/nora-quoirin/\">Nora,</a> who had learning difficulties, was first reported missing by her devastated mum and dad Meabh and Sebastian Quoirin back in August 2019.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She vanished from her bedroom at the Dusun Resort, surrounded by thick <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/malaysia/\">Malaysian</a> jungle.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She was found naked ten days later at the bottom of a rocky slope.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A coroner said Nora likely starved to death in the period of time she was missing, and died from internal bleeding.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, Nora&#8217;s heartbroken parents Meabh and Sebastien argued their daughter would never have wandered away alone.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They demanded an inquest which opened yesterday.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>&#8216;Nothing suspicious&#8217;</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Police chief Yusop, who was in charge of the hunt for Nora, said at the time he inspected the family&#8217;s holiday bungalow and found nothing suspicious.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And the resort&#8217;s owner, Haanim Ahmed Bamadhaj, said the window that Nora is said to have climbed from had a broken latch.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It had been disassembled and presented to the court.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The bungalow did not have any CCTV.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mr Mat Yusop added: &#8220;The family was distraught when I met them. I assured the father we will use all our resources to find the missing girl.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mr and Mrs Quoirin pushed for the inquest, and are due to give evidence via videolink later this week.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/10573689/nora-quoirin-parents-malaysia-criminal-justice/\">The couple said previously they believe &#8220;crucial time&#8221; was lost at the beginning of the search for Nora</a>, who was born with the brain defect holoprosencephaly.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>&#8216;Criminal element&#8217;</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking&#160;<a href=\"https://www.rte.ie/news/2019/1217/1101725-we-want-truth-and-justice-for-nora-quoirin-family/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">to RTE News in Ireland</a>, Meabh said: &#8220;I think it wouldn&#8217;t be out of character, for us it would be impossible physically, mentally to imagine that she could have got any distance at all.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;And for us, something very complex happened.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We&#8217;ve insisted from the beginning that we believe there was a criminal element to what happened.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;And crucially we were struggling because it was difficult to get the resources in place fast enough to explore a criminal angle.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;And, you know, we believe that crucial time and evidence was lost in the beginning.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/9737783/nora-quoirin-news-mccann-cop-jim-gamble-malaysia/\">The parents&#8217; suspicions have been backed by a top cop&#160;</a>who worked on the Madeleine McCann case.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Child Protection expert Jim Gamble, who has been advising the Quoirin family, told&#160;<a href=\"https://news.sky.com/story/nora-quoirin-grandfather-backs-foul-play-theory-someone-tried-to-get-rid-of-her-11786358\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Sky News</a>: “I understand why in the aftermath of the interim results of the post-mortem, there are still questions especially for the parents.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He added: “I think the view of the family, as I know it, is of course, there are still questions.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-news\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">More news on Nora Quoirin</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-wrapper\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491162/nora-quoirin-no-cuts-feet-jungle-inquest/\">\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"delayed-image-load-landscape\" data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-NORA.jpg?strip=all&#038;w=300&#038;h=192&#038;crop=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"delayed-image-load-mobile\" data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-NORA.jpg?strip=all&#038;w=300&#038;h=192&#038;crop=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t</a>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Add video indicator if article has feature video. -->\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-play theme__background-color-rgba-80\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span></span>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-image -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tNORA RIDDLE\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tBrit &#039;couldn&#039;t walk 20ft alone &#38; had no cuts&#039; but cops say she wasn&#039;t kidnapped\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491162/nora-quoirin-no-cuts-feet-jungle-inquest/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- period of search, while we know where she ended up, while we know the interim results of the post-mortem and have no reason to doubt those, we don’t know how she left the villa.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“We don’t know how she got from the villa to the location where she was finally found.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“We need to understand, why over a period of six or seven days while she was alive, with intense, well-resourced searching going on in the area, she wasn’t seen or located.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Quoirins told AFP in a statement: &#8220;We hope that all avenues surrounding Nora&#8217;s disappearance will be fully explored and not just the theory which the police has always favoured.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491432\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Tesco website down as customers unable to access website or complete orders","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12492683/tesco-website-down-order-food/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>TESCO&#8217;S website is currently down, leaving shoppers unable to order groceries online.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Furious customers have been complaining to the supermarket on Twitter after the web page crashed mid-way through their shop.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492704\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tesco.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492704\" width=\"960\" height=\"537\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Tesco&#8217;s website shows the following error page</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>One shopper said they spent two hours adding items to their online order before the website went down.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Others say they managed to add everything to their basket, only to get an error page at the payment screen.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They tweeted: &#8220;Your website is a shambles. Just taken a couple of hours to put an order in and now your site is down just as I was adding the last item!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Another said: &#8220;I&#8217;ve just spent ages adding it all to my basket will not be amused if i lose it completely. So many people on website no chance of rebooking.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tescodwon1.png?strip=all&#38;w=582\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492918\" width=\"582\" height=\"134\" />\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tescodown2.png?strip=all&#38;w=562\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492921\" width=\"562\" height=\"161\" />\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tescodown3.png?strip=all&#38;w=576\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492924\" width=\"576\" height=\"223\" />\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492994\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 587px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-187.png?strip=all&#38;w=577\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492994\" width=\"577\" height=\"135\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Tesco customers have been tweeting the supermarket</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>A third tweeted: &#8220;Have been trying to checkout my Tesco online order for the last 15 minutes and constantly getting an error that the payment page is unavailable. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Tried on phone, same problem. Am running out of time for my slot. What&#8217;s up with your website?&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A fourth asked: &#8220;Is your website not working? I have an grocery order I&#8217;ve just done but it won’t let me go through to the payment page?&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Shoppers are now concerned they&#8217;ll have to start their order all over again, as well as worrying that their timed delivery slot won&#8217;t still be reserved when they can get back online.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/tesco/\">Tesco</a> has replied to several customers saying that if they already added items to their basket, their order should still be there when the website is back up.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, shoppers may need to find a new delivery slot if their original time is no longer available.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Replying to one customer on Twitter, Tesco said: &#8220;Your shopping basket should not empty, but you will need to look for a new slot once the website is fixed.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Customers say they can&#8217;t complete orders on both the desktop and mobile Tesco websites.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The supermarket hasn&#8217;t revealed the cause of the problem, or how many shoppers are affected.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It appears the website went down around an hour ago, based on when customers started tweeting Tesco.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A notice on the Tesco desktop website reads: &#8220;Because our site is so busy right now, you may experience some delays.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Please wait and refresh this page occasionally, as it won&#8217;t refresh automatically. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We&#8217;re sorry for any inconvenience and thank you for your patience.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Tesco confirmed to The Sun that it&#8217;s looking into the issue &#8211; we&#8217;ll update this article when we get more information.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"No10 deny claims from Dominic Cummings’ father-in-law that Boris Johnson will QUIT as PM in 6 months","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491647/no10-nonsense-stand-down-cummings-dad/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>DOWNING Street has been forced to deny claims Boris Johnson is set to quit within six months because of continued illness from Covid-19 as &#8220;utter nonsense&#8221;. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>No10 has knocked back a report quoting chief adviser Dominic Cummings&#8217; father-in-law suggesting that the PM was ready to step down because of the toll coronavirus has taken on him. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491872\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000600363277-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491872\" width=\"960\" height=\"720\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AP:Associated Press</figcredit></figure>No10 said it was &#8220;utter nonsense&#8221; Boris Johnson would be resigning[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The claims made by <a href=\"https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/putting-pm-out-to-stud-mtzzfdvh0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">The Times diary column</a> cited journalist Anna Silverman, who had visited Chillingham Castle in Northumberland, which is home to Sir Humphry Wakefield, the father of Mr Cummings&#8217; wife Mary.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sir Humphry apparently &#8220;merrily&#8221; told Ms Silverman that Mr Johnson is &#8220;still struggling badly with having had Covid-19&#8221; and &#8220;will stand down in six months&#8221;. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>But the claims have been laughed off by Downing Street. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>A No10 spokesperson told The Sun: &#8220;This is nonsense&#8221;. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The PM was admitted to the intensive care unit at St Thomas&#8217; Hospital in London in April after he became sick with the virus, along with Health Secretary Matt Hancock and Chief Medical Officer Professor Chris Whitty. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Neither Professor Whitty or Mr Hancock needed hospitalistion. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mr Johnson was <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/11381122/inside-story-boris-coronavirus-battle/\">given &#8220;oxygen treatment&#8221; and spent three days in intensive care. </a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>In a video following his discharge from hospital, Johnson thanked health service staff for saving his life.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He said the NHS had &#8220;saved his life&#8221;. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491915\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000594171085.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491915\" width=\"960\" height=\"707\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy Live News</figcredit></figure>Dominic Cummings&#8217; father-in-law is said to be behind the reports[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491908\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000576701683.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491908\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy Live News</figcredit></figure>Boris Johnson after he was discharged from hospital[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>He applauded the work of two nurses Mr Johnson said stayed at his side for 48 hours “when things could have gone either way.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The PM spent <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/11386212/boris-johnson-chequers-carrie-lockdown/\">some time at Chequers with fiancé Carrie</a> after his stint in hospital. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mr Cummings&#8217;, the PM&#8217;s chief adviser, was <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/11695331/dominic-cummings-second-time-lockdown-trip/\">the centre of an uproar when he was accused of breaking lockdown rules </a>when he and his wife drove from London to Durham. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mr Cummings has been ridiculed after claiming he took at trip to tourist destination Barnard Castle to &#8220;test his eyes&#8221;. +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000600363277-1.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"9308909fe6d43bd1fd8d8290b2b8d420","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn73@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-545_6d7c133eb9690ea8.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":720,"sourceBytes":121528,"destBytes":121528,"author":"Sascha O'Sullivan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000600363277-1.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn73@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-545_6d7c133eb9690ea8.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000594171085.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-35-293_79f42d4e75798ca6.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000576701683.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn33@2020_1/2020/08/25/11-06-43-138_ab86a0512cdda023.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584765},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Netflix’s Titans star reveals racist backlash after being cast as Starfire as a black woman","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12491656/netflix-titans-star-reveals-racist-backlash-starfire/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>NETFLIX&#8217;s Titans star reveals a racist backlash after she was cast as Starfire as a black woman.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Several black actors took part in an event in DC FanDome to discuss the challenges they&#8217;ve faced in their respective roles and why representation in their industry is so important.</p>\n\n\n\n<ul><li><strong>The <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11241040/best-series-to-watch-on-netflix/\">best series</a> on Netflix</strong></li><li><strong>The <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11250817/best-films-watch-netflix/\">best movies</a>&#160;on Netflix</strong></li></ul>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492036\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Starfire.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492036\" width=\"640\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Starfire actress Anna Diop revealed racist backlash after being cast in the role</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>They also discussed how the response from fans has made them realise how vital it is to see actresses of colour in superhero roles.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Starfire star Anna Diop explained how she overcame the criticism she experienced: &#8220;There was a lot of backlash because some people were upset that it was a Black woman that they cast.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;And I had to lean into my friends and my family and my faith in a way that I haven&#8217;t really had to do before.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She added: &#8220;But, it&#8217;s incredible to see what that meant for a lot of people, a lot of marginalised people reached out to me, be it Black or gay or trans or whatever, and it&#8217;s incredible to be even some small inspiration for them.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492040\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000462467976.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492040\" width=\"960\" height=\"650\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>PR Handout</figcredit></figure>Anna said it felt &#8216;incredible&#8217; to be an inspiration to marginalised people[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Nafeesa Williams, who plays Anissa Pierce in CW&#8217;s Black Lightning, made history by becoming the first woman to play a black lesbian superhero.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She said: &#8220;I&#8217;m really honoured to play this role of the first Black lesbian superhero.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Because when I think of that, I think of all the Black lesbians who have not been able to visually see themselves when they go to the cinema or they watch their favourite TV shows.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She continued: &#8220;And for me, it&#8217;s one thing knowing that there is a role for it, but when you&#8217;re in that role and you&#8217;re getting feedback, you realise the importance of it and how much it is necessary and how much you need it.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">What&#039;s on Netflix and Amazon Thwaites) transformation into Nightwing at the end of the second series.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Jason Todd (Curran Walters) will ditch the Robin moniker and go by the name Red Hood instead, a name which he Llewellyn","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Starfire.jpg?strip=all&w=640":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn23@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-27-321_03b967fdc33cbd96.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000462467976.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn63@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-29-394_e705f240292453fb.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/titans-season-1-anna-diop-starfire.jpeg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn19@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-31-911_04e2a622150c5a67.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584682},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Thrifty mum shares how she bagged £30 Morrisons shop for just £3 after struggling to make ends meet before payday","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/12491565/thrifty-mym-bagged-morrisons-shop-cheap-app-too-good-to-go/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A MUM-OF-THREE has revealed how she bagged a £30 Morrisons shop for just £3 after struggling to make ends meet before payday.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Alice Griffiths, 25, from Southport, was down to her last £5 before payday when she ordered a £3.09 &#8220;Magic Box&#8221; from Morrisons through the <a href=\"https://toogoodtogo.co.uk/en-gb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">Too Good To Go app</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491734\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 409px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005223.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=399\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491734\" width=\"399\" height=\"523\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Latest Deals</figcredit></figure>Mum-of-three Alice Griffiths was down to her last £5 before payday when she ordered one of Morrisons&#8217; &#8216;Magic Boxes&#8217;[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>In an interview with <a href=\"https://www.latestdeals.co.uk/news/savvy-mum-reveals-she-bagged-30-food-shopping-just-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">Latest Deals</a>, the thrifty mum explained how she was able to feed her family for a week using the service &#8211; which offers shoppers discounted food which is past the &#8220;best before&#8221; date but is still fine to eat.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Alice said: &#8220;I knew that at the least I would get enough vegetables for soup and so on for us to last a couple of days.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;This was my fourth box, and I would say this one was definitely worth it! It had enough meals to feed me and my husband for the next seven days.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Praising the &#8220;game-changing&#8221; service, Alice explained how she received a chicken pie, two microwave carbonaras, mushrooms, cheesy chicken breasts, bacon, cook in the bag chicken, lettuce, a microwave mash, vegetable medley, sausages and a microwave fish and chips in one box.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491893\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 810px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604001392.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=800\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491893\" width=\"800\" height=\"600\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Latest Deals</figcredit></figure>The £3.09 box contained enough food to feed the family for a week[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491735\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 730px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604001407.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=720\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491735\" width=\"720\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Latest Deals</figcredit></figure>She has previously received boxes full of sweet treats[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>She added: &#8220;If I paid full price for all of that I reckon it would have cost around £25 to £30.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, the mum revealed that you never know exactly what you&#8217;ll get in the boxes &#8211; and has previously received ones full of fruit and veg and one with donuts.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Offering up her top tips, Alice said: &#8220;The new boxes get released each evening around 18:15 on the Too Good To Go app and you have to keep refreshing the page until it says available. They sell out so fast!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And to make her food shop go a little bit further, Alice will freeze vegetable portions and loafs of bread &#8211; and joked that her &#8220;freezer is [her] best friend&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>What&#8217;s more, the bargain-hunting mum also likes to shop in the reduced aisle of the supermarket to get the best deals as well as using money-saving apps like Too Good To Go.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col summer","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12492322/man-utd-donny-van-de-beek-transfer-ajax/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>MANCHESTER UNITED target Donny van de Beek is expecting Premier League offers this summer, according to reports. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Ajax midfielder looks set to leave the Dutch champions this summer.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492974\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/26bf2e91-ce7a-43c3-ac75-3550aa3847ed.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492974\" width=\"960\" height=\"767\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Ajax star Donny van de Beek is expecting offers from the Premier League this summer[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>But the 23-year-old is happy in Holland&#8217;s capital and is not fazed by the prospect of staying. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Dutch international <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/10746642/man-utd-transfer-real-madrid-van-de-beek/\">Van de Beek was close to agreeing a £47million transfer to Real Madrid</a> before lockdown.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Ajax director &#8211; and former Red Devils goalkeeper &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/11808812/van-de-beek-utd-transfer-ajax-madrid/\">Edwin van der Sar confirmed he could leave for the right price</a> earlier this year.</p>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><strong><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12390714/man-utd-transfer-news-live-jadon-sancho-dembele-pogba/\">MAN UTD NEWS LIVE: Click here for the latest United news</a></strong></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<p>But offers are expected to come from the Premier League &#8211; where Van de Beek would be happy to play, according to <a href=\"https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11913/12055838/donny-van-de-beek-awaits-premier-league-offers-but-is-happy-at-ajax\">Sky Sports News</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Arsenal and Manchester City are both in the market for centre-midfielders.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But only a Champions League side would be able to attract such a talented star so the Gunners are unlikely to be in the running.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Van de Beek still has two years left on his contract which expires in June 2022 &#8211; which means any transfer fee would be quite significant.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But it is not expected to be quite as much as the £47m pre-lockdown amount because of the financial impact of coronavirus on clubs.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ajax want any deal wrapped up before their Eredivisie campaign kicks off against Sparta Rotterdam on September 13.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>United were <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/11872843/man-utd-path-van-de-beek/\">heavily linked with the Dutchman in the January transfer window. </a></p>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"wp-block-group\"><div class=\"wp-block-group__inner-container\">\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12371286/transfer-news-live-winks-man-city-cristiano-ronaldo-barcelona-spurs-liverpool/\">TRANSFER NEWS LIVE: Breaking news, juicy gossip and the biggest deals</a></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n</div></div>\n\n\n\n<p>But having since signed Bruno Fernandes and welcomed Paul Pogba back into the fold, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is likely to have priorities elsewhere.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Asked about his future in January, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/10736654/manchester-united-van-de-beek/\">Van de Beek revealed he was in no hurry to leave the Amsterdam side.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>He said: &#8220;It is not that I can or want to do something at the moment.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div </p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Man-Utd-Top-Fixtures-2.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Man-Utd-Top-Fixtures-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12450998\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" /></a>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\">\n\t\t\t\t\t</video>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<script src=\"https://players.brightcove.net/5067014667001/default_default/index.min.js\"></script>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\n\t\t<!-- End of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 10:58:43 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/26bf2e91-ce7a-43c3-ac75-3550aa3847ed.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"6502c005b000e90b8686e75a81daf22b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn22@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-25-180_8ff7d6287d9cb8d5.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":767,"sourceBytes":110702,"destBytes":110702,"author":"William Pugh","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/26bf2e91-ce7a-43c3-ac75-3550aa3847ed.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn22@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-25-180_8ff7d6287d9cb8d5.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Man-Utd-Top-Fixtures-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn13@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-39-455_ad6e34a01acbb0dc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584650},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"I spent my 21st birthday cuddling my stillborn baby – now I’m selling her tiny clothes so I can afford a headstone","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/12484090/i-spent-my-21st-birthday-cuddling-my-stillborn-baby-now-im-selling-her-tiny-clothes-so-i-can-afford-a-headstone/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>A NEW mum has described her heartbreak after she spent her 21st birthday cradling her stillborn daughter.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Courtney Marshall was delighted to learn she was expecting her first child in March this year. But only 21 weeks into the pregnancy, she went into labour.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12484429\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 931px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/a15dd043-034f-4f5f-8425-f9286737a37f.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=921\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12484429\" width=\"921\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Courtney pictured with baby Kathleen after she arrived stillborn</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Her daughter, Kathleen, was born without a heartbeat and Courtney spent her 21st birthday in the bereavement suite with her.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But because she was born at 21 weeks &#8211; before the cut-off limit of 24 weeks &#8211; Courtney doesn&#8217;t benefit from the government&#8217;s Children’s Funeral Fund for England which can help to pay for some of the costs of a funeral for a child under 18 or a baby stillborn after the 24th week of pregnancy.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Courtney, 21, from Stafford, says: “I had planned a family celebration for my 21st. Instead, I spent the day cuddling my stillborn daughter. It was heartbreaking.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“The midwives were so kind. They bought me a photo frame to keep her picture in, and bought me a birthday cake and banners.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12484514\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3d8783ac-931c-4f99-b3fa-c35cf4c766b6.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12484514\" width=\"960\" height=\"703\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">While pregnant with Kathleen</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12484584\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 408px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/7b61eca5-4eae-4482-841d-b8966147b65c.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=398\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12484584\" width=\"398\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Mum Courtney at her daughter&#8217;s grave</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>“Now, I’m fundraising to buy Kathleen a headstone. Babies born before 24 weeks don’t qualify for funding for a gravestone which seems so cruel. She is still a baby after all.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I’m having to try to sell the baby clothes I had bought for her, to pay for her headstone and that doesn’t seem right.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Courtney, who is single, was surprised but excited when she fell pregnant earlier this year.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She says: “The pregnancy wasn’t planned, but I have always wanted a baby, since before I could remember. I was so thrilled when I felt her starting to move and kick inside me and I loved having a bump. I especially wanted a daughter too.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Courtney suffers from Fowler’s syndrome, which causes urinary retention, but was assured it would not affect her pregnancy.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t<blockquote class=\"article__quote\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article__quote-copy theme__before-color theme__after-color\">\n\t\t\t<p>I had planned a family celebration for my 21st. Instead, I spent the day cuddling my stillborn daughter. It was heartbreaking.</p>\n\t\t\t\t<cite class=\"article__quote-credit theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"quote-credit\">Courtney Marshall</span><span class=\"quote-credit-meta\">21</span>\t\t\t\t</cite>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t</blockquote>\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>But in July, at 21 weeks pregnant, she went into labour. She gave birth to daughter Kathleen Anne, on July 27, weighing just 300g.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Courtney says; “I was in labour for 24 hours and I was begging the doctors to save her but it was too early. There was nothing they could do and I had to give birth, knowing she would not survive.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She spent the next three days at the Royal Stoke University Hospital with Kathleen in a cold cot.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She says: “At first, I was scared even to hold her, she was so tiny, and I was scared I might hurt her. But the midwives helped me to dress her, and we made keepsake handprints and footprints, which are now in her memory box at home. I will always treasure that special time I spent with her.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“On the third day, it was my 21st birthday. I was supposed to be having a party with my sister, Stacey, and her children, but I couldn’t have left my baby on her own. It was heart-breaking sitting there with her in my arms, on my birthday, thinking about what could have been.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12484560\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 730px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ce840815-8ca8-4fc6-a73d-692ec1d32db9.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=720\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12484560\" width=\"720\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Baby Kathleen sadly arrived stillborn</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12484575\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 730px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2bdc6538-23c0-4409-9a47-6608450cbcb9.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=720\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12484575\" width=\"720\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Courtney, her sister Stacey and baby Kathleen in hospital</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>“The midwives bought me a cake and banners and a photo frame as a keepsake. They really looked after me.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Since losing Kathleen, I’ve found it tough. I’ve had mental health issues in the past but I want to stay strong, for her. I am focussing on making her proud.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“We had her funeral earlier this week and I’ve spent a lot of time at her grave. I’m fundraising for a headstone, I’m even having to sell some of her stuff, which doesn’t seem right. I’m not working, so it’s a struggle. She is still a human being and I think it’s appalling that I don’t qualify for any help.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Courtney has since been told it is thought that a womb infection caused her premature labour.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>You can help Courtney raise funds for a headstone for her daughter at<strong> &#160;</strong><a href=\"https://www.gofundme.com/f/raising-funds-for-my-daughters-headstone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">https://www.gofundme.com/f/raising-funds-for-my-daughters-headstone</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>A Ministry of Justice spokeswoman said: “The loss of a baby is a tragedy and our thoughts are with Ms Marshall.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Thousands of parents have accessed the Children’s Funeral Fund since we launched it last year, reducing the financial burden at such a difficult time.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">What is the fund to help parents who&#039;ve lost children... and why doesn&#039;t Courtney qualify?</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p>The Children’s Funeral Fund for England can help to pay for some of the costs of a funeral for a child under 18 or a baby stillborn after the 24th week of pregnancy.</p>\n<p>Irrespective of what you earn you get the same amount.</p>\n<p>You can get:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>burial fees</li>\n<li>cremation fees, including the cost of a doctor’s certificate</li>\n<li>coffin, shroud or casket (up to a cost of £300)</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Usually the funeral director will submit the cost, but if you have you can reclaim (within six months) <a href=\"https://claim-for-costs-of-a-childs-funeral.form.service.justice.gov.uk/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">here</a>.</p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div got our kids school ready for just £9 each including ALL their uniforms\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/12454179/school-uniform-aldi-asda/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Meanwhile, Emma told Fabulous how <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/7858899/i-spent-14-days-with-my-dead-baby-girl-and-even-took-her-for-walks-in-the-pram/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">she spent 14 days with her daughter after she died, even taking her for walks in the pram</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And a heartbroken mum&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/5853760/heartbroken-mum-photographs-stillborn-son/\">who delivered a stillborn baby</a>&#160;released poignant photographs of him &#8211; and told how it has helped her heal.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And, one woman told how distressing it was to&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/5966119/mum-agony-delivering-stillborn/\">deliver her child</a>, knowing he had died in her womb.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"How Chelsea will smash transfer record on Kai Havertz and Thiago Silva – but it’ll cost them just £4m","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12491196/chelsea-havertz-transfer-silva-net-spend/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>CHELSEA look set to splash a club-record £90million on Kai Havertz &#8211; but it will cost them just £4m.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Blues have enjoyed a bumper summer of spending so far already, bringing in Timo Werner and Hakim Ziyech.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492076\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 907px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/GL-graphic-chelsea-net-profit.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=897\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492076\" width=\"897\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Chelsea have made a monster net profit since last summer</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491567\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6be0e92d-3f2c-47cb-b063-a67e9d5bbb9a.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491567\" width=\"960\" height=\"662\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Kai Havertz could end up costing Chelsea just £4m of their own money[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Werner cost Frank Lampard and Co £48m from RB Leipzig, while ex-Ajax winger Ziyech cost £33m up front, with that fee potentially rising to £36.7m.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Havertz and Silva look to be next, with deals that would see them head to Stamford Bridge set to go ahead this week.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Veteran centre-back <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12488259/chelsea-agree-thiago-silva-deal/\">Silva will be a free transfer</a> after his contract at Paris Saint-Germain expired.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12483983/chelsea-transfer-kai-havertz-agreed/\">Havertz will cost considerably more</a>, with Bayer Leverkusen insisting on an up-front fee of £90m</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But despite forking out a massive amount on the German, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1196660/chelsea/\">Chelsea</a> will <strong>STILL</strong> only have to find £4m.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>That&#8217;s because, since the summer of 2019, Chelsea have actually made a net <strong>PROFIT</strong> of £86m, thanks in no small part to being under a transfer ban last summer.</p>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h3><strong><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12287166/chelsea-transfer-news-live-kai-havertz-reguilon-chilwell-zaha/\">CHELSEA NEWS LIVE: Click here for the latest Blues news</a></strong></h3>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<script type=\"application/javascript\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/pollingwidgets/v3/widget.js?question_id=2870&#038;game=polling\"></script>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491562\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603496230-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491562\" width=\"960\" height=\"591\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Thiago Silva is set to sign a two-year deal at Chelsea on a free transfer[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The Blues sold Hazard to Real Madrid a year ago in a deal worth £88m up front, potentially rising to £150m.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As things stand, Hazard has made the Blues around £100m &#8211; which has helped bankroll a major 2020 splurge.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Chelsea also waved goodbye to Alvaro Morata in January 2019, on an 18-month loan deal to Atletico Madrid.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Six months in, Atleti agreed to take on the Spaniard permanently at the end of the loan, meaning they should have now paid the £58m fee this summer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Since last summer, the Blues have also sold Mario Pasalic (Atalanta, £14m), David Luiz (Arsenal, £8m) and Ola Aina (Torino, £9m).</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Tomas Kalas (Bristol City, £8m), Michael Hector (Fulham, £5m) and Kenneth Omeruo (Leganes, £5m) have also been moved on.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Chelsea have therefore raked in £203m in sales since last summer.</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SPORTS-GRAPHIC-EXPENSIVE-SIGNINGS-CHELSEA-v2.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SPORTS-GRAPHIC-EXPENSIVE-SIGNINGS-CHELSEA-v2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12278425\" width=\"960\" height=\"860\" /></a>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"wp-block-group\"><div class=\"wp-block-group__inner-container\">\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12371286/transfer-news-live-winks-man-city-cristiano-ronaldo-barcelona-spurs-liverpool/\">TRANSFER NEWS LIVE: Breaking news, juicy gossip and the biggest deals</a></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n</div></div>\n\n\n\n<p>In return, they made Mateo Kovacic&#8217;s loan move from Real Madrid permanent in a £40m deal &#8211; as well as landing Werner and Ziyech.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>All-in-all, the West Londoners have spent just £121m.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>That means, they are currently £86m in <strong>PROFIT</strong> ahead of moves for Havertz and Silva.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Once those deals are done, Chelsea will have spent just £4m in their year-long squad overhaul.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12467729/chelsea-leicester-ben-chilwell-transfer-medical/\">Ben Chilwell is tipped to join in a £50m deal</a>, with Declan Rice on the cards for a fee of around £45m.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12471192/chelsea-transfer-splurge-chilwell-havertz-rice/\">Roman Abramovich recently agreed to pour £150m</a> of his own money into the club to bankroll major transfers.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Should Chelsea sign Havertz and Silva for &#8220;£4m&#8221;, then even a combined £95m on Rice and Chilwell would see them have £51m still to spend.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Flop goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga is set to be sold and replaced this summer.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-sport\" data-slide-count=\"4\" 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Virgin Atlantic to ‘run out of money’ by end of September if bailout isn’t approved","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12491546/virgin-atlantic-bailout-september/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>VIRGIN Atlantic could run out of money in a matter of weeks if a rescue plan isn’t agreed today. </strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Richard Branson’s airline <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12313844/richard-branson-virgin-atlantic-bankruptcy-protection/\">filed for bankruptcy protection in the US</a> at the start of the month in an effort to save the company and thousands of jobs after it fell into administration.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491763\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000390602876.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491763\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>The company’s creditors will vote on a £1.2 billion rescue deal needed to secure the airline&#8217;s future [/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Virgin Atlantic has been hit hard by the pandemic, with thousands of planes grounded worldwide in April due to fears over the spread of the virus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Today the company’s creditors will vote on a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12118154/richard-branson-virgin-atlantic-rescue-deal-jobs/\">£1.2 billion rescue plan agreed in July</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It includes a £170million cash injection from US hedge fund Davidson Kempner and means Sir Richard Branson maintains a controlling stake in the businesses.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The airline, which is 51% owned by Richard Branson&#8217;s Virgin Group and 49% by U.S. airline Delta, said it “remains confident” in the restructuring plan and is on track to become solvent again by September.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Today the airline&#8217;s creditors will vote on the plan that involves 170 suppliers taking a 20% cut in the money Virgin Atlantic owes them. They will get the rest in staggered payments.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They need to support the vote if the airline is to keep flying. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>At an earlier hearing Virgin Atlantic lawyer David Allison QC told the High Court passenger demand had &#8220;plummeted to a level that would until recently have been unthinkable&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He added the company would “run out of money altogether” by the final week of the month if help wasn’t granted.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>If successful, another UK court hearing will be held on Sept 2 to approve the plan, and a procedural hearing is scheduled for Sept 3 in the United States.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Should the creditors fail to support the plan; the judge can still rule that it is in their interests for it to go ahead.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>When an airline fails you won&#8217;t get a refund for flights booked unless your holiday is Atol protected. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>You maybe able to get a refund via your insurer or bank. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Globally, the travel and aviation industry is feeling the financial hit following months of lockdown and cancelled flights and holidays.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It is expected that<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12314489/three-million-british-travel-and-tourism-jobs-on-verge-of-disappearing-due-to-coronavirus/\"> nearly three million British travel and ­tourism jobs </a>are on the verge of disappearing — while the economy is close to losing £142billion from the travel sector.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>There are fears that closures of airlines and travel firms will push up the cost of taking a holiday in the future. </p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/11501983/british-airways-12000-workers-redundant/\">British Airways</a> are slashing up to 12,000 jobs from its 42,000-strong workforce due to a collapse in flight numbers.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12467845/sta-travel-ceases-trading-coronavirus/\">STA Travel UK has gone out of business </a>leaving thousands of customers chasing refunds.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Branson, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/4412685/richard-branson-nhs-necker-island/\">who has a personal wealth of almost £4 billion</a>, faced criticism after calling on the UK government to help prop up the firm.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He previously lobbied for a £500million loan funded by public cash to help keep the airline alive.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The billionaire said he was prepared to put his private she shocked Swingers viewers with tales from her wild orgies.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In a Channel 4 documentary last night, curious Brits got the chance to peek inside one of the country’s 200 sex clubs to discover what really goes on, with exclusive private members’ club Liberty Elite.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491710\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 490px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Screen-Shot-2020-08-25-at-10.04.18.png?strip=all&#38;w=480\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491710\" href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12482882/swingers-channel-four-liberty-elite-club/\">Siobhan</a>, who visits the Liberty Elite club, says she didn’t even like sex until she was 57 – because she was sexually assaulted at the age of 17.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But after 10 years in the swinging scene, she&#8217;s now extremely happy with her sex life and loves throwing orgies with younger men inside <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12482882/swingers-channel-four-liberty-elite-club/\">Siobhan&#8217;s sex &#8216;playroom&#8217;.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Her &#8220;playroom&#8221; has floral bedsheets and looks like a normal spare room with violet painted walls and teddy bears on the bed.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>There, she has as many as eight men in their 20s over for debauched orgies.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491728\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Screen-Shot-2020-08-25-at-10.01.58.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491728\" width=\"960\" height=\"527\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The 67-year-old showed off her sex toy collection</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Siobhan said in the documentary: &#8220;When I first did this I couldn’t believe a twenty-year-old would want to have sex with a sixty something year old, but they do, and I’m happy to oblige.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Swinging is very empowering. I’m in charge of my life, and swinging is part of that life. The main thing is being in control of my sex life.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The most sessions I&#8217;ve had in a day is probably three or four.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;One reason why I may not have married is I think I may get bored just with one person.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491711\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Screen-Shot-2020-08-25-at-10.04.09.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491711\" width=\"960\" height=\"583\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Siobhan says swinging is &#8217;empowering&#8217;</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491718\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Screen-Shot-2020-08-25-at-10.01.23.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491718\" width=\"960\" height=\"525\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">She talked through her sexual experiences on the documentary</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>One viewer said: &#8220;Siobhan is living life at 67.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Another added: &#8220;some nasty tweets about Siobhan on #swingers at 67 she’s finally able to reclaim her sexuality and sense of self. Good for you Siobhan you naughty minx.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Someone else said: &#8220;OMG I have just turned on @Channel4 to #swingers Siobhan&#8230;&#8230;wowzers!! battle","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12491832/britney-spears-prays-more-confidence-spiritual-crystals/","description":"<p>BRITNEY Spears has revealed she is collecting crystals in the hope they will bring her &#8216;more confidence&#8217; following her recent court battle.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/who/britney-spears/\">Britney</a>, 38, last week lost a bid to take control of her own finances and has now decided to &#8216;go back to things she loved&#8217; when she was a child. </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491819\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 779px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000598526481-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=769\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image
