.rail__item-image -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tDI&#039;S DEMISE\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tEmmerdale boss reveals original plans for DI Malone&#039;s death\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12456074/emmerdale-boss-reveals-original-plans-malone-death/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;They’re all great people and all having to grow up in very crazy circumstances. As a private person, I just feel like, leave people alone – unless you’re talking about their work or what they want to talk about.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking broadly about the sexualisation of young actors, she reflected that it is &#8220;a cultural issue&#8221;.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“It’s a very tricky and complex issue,” she said.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“There must be a bigger concept behind it as to why. Just let people be the people that they are, without any judgement.”</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 10:44:13 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000502967916.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"0f2dd707358b2bb38532e983aa3b1808","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn34@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-26-505_d780cfa967b41363.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":474,"sourceBytes":36462,"destBytes":36462,"author":"Eve Wagstaff","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000502967916.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn34@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-26-505_d780cfa967b41363.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000561948358-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn40@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-34-893_cb5535db3c721c47.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000571238050.jpg?strip=all&w=600":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn84@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-29-492_5c96cbc58adb1b49.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584692},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Ancient Egyptian monkey skeleton graveyard where pet primates were buried like sleeping children by their owners dug up","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12491076/ancient-egyptian-pet-cemetery-monkey-skeletons/","description":"<p><strong>ANCIENT monkey skeletons have been dug up at a 2,000-year-old animal cemetery near the Red Sea in Egypt.</strong></p> \n<p>The creatures are thought to have been beloved pets of Romans and Egyptians who buried them in sleeping positions.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12491863\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005866.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491863\" width=\"960\" height=\"621\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Marta Osypińska\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The monkey’s are thought to have been pets[/caption] \n<p>The animal cemetery is located near the Red Sea port of Berenice.</p> \n<p>It was used by Romans and Egyptians to import animals from India.</p> \n<p>Analysis of the monkey remains confirmed that the animals were of Asian origin.</p> \n<p>They were buried as if sleeping ‘like children’ and decorated with shells.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12491868\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005870.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491868\" width=\"960\" height=\"516\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Marta Osypińska\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The ancient port is located near the Red Sea[/caption] \n<p>Some were found near mummified kittens.</p> \n<p>The care taken in the burials of these creatures indicates that they were of importance when they were alive.</p> \n<p>A lot of the monkey skeletons were quite young, suggesting they struggled to adapt to their new life in Egypt.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12491867\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005878.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491867\" width=\"960\" height=\"694\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Marta Osypińska\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The monkeys were buried near mummified kittens[/caption] \n<figure id=\"attachment_12491864\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005865.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491864\" width=\"960\" height=\"621\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Marta Osypińska\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Some of the burials had been decorated with shells[/caption] \n<p>According to <a href=\"https://www.thefirstnews.com/article/remains-of-2000-year-old-monkeys-buried-like-sleeping-children-reveal-romans-and-ancient-egyptians-imported-them-from-india-as-household-pets-15142\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">First News</a>, archaeologists identified the monkeys as rhesus macaques which are usually found in India.</p> \n<p>Initially, it was presumed the monkeys were native to Egypt but 3D scanning and bone comparisons has been able to prove otherwise.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12491866\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005877.jpg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491866\" width=\"960\" height=\"691\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Marta Osypińska\n </figcredit>\n</figure>These trays contain remains of monkeys, cats and dogs[/caption] \n<p>Researchers have been working at the Berenice site for over 10 years and have made other large discoveries including that of a fortress and a huge underground complex.</p> \n<p>Remains of dogs and a piglet were also found at the site.</p> \n<p>Professor Marta Osypińska, a zooarchaeologist from the Polish Academy of Sciences, said: “We believe that the influential Romans who lived in Berenice, a faraway outpost, in the first and second, wanted to make their time pleasant with the company of various animals.</p> \n<p>“Among them were also monkeys.”</p> \n<p>One of the monkeys was placed under a woollen cloth and two others had large shells put on their heads.</p> \n<p>Osypińska told <a href=\"https://www.thefirstnews.com/article/remains-of-2000-year-old-monkeys-buried-like-sleeping-children-reveal-romans-and-ancient-egyptians-imported-them-from-india-as-household-pets-15142\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">The First News</a>: “This is a unique finding. </p> \n<p>“Until now, no one has found Indian monkeys in the archaeological sites in Africa. Interestingly, even ancient written sources don’t mention this practice.”</p> \n<p>The Berenice sea port was taken over from the Egyptians by invading Romans.</p> \n<p>It was used as a trading posts, which the monkeys would have had to travel thousands of miles across the sea to reach.</p> \n<p>This discovery was made by researchers from Warsaw University’s Center of Mediterranean Archeology, in collaboration with experts at the University of Delaware.</p> \n<div class=\"article-boxout\"> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\"> \n  <h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">A brief history of Ancient Egypt</h3> \n </div> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\"> \n  <div class=\"article-boxout__content-img\"> \n   <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/All_Gizah_Pyramids.jpg?strip=all&amp;&amp;w=620&amp;&amp;h=413&amp;&amp;crop=1\" width=\"620\" height=\"413\" /> \n  </div> \n  <p class=\"article__content--intro\"> Here's everything you need to know... </p>  \n  <ul> \n   <li>The Ancient Egyptians were an advanced civilisation who at one point owned a huge portion of the globe</li> \n   <li>The civilisation began about 5,000 years ago when ancient humans began building villages along the River Nile</li> \n   <li>It lasted for about 3,000 years and saw the building of complex cities centuries ahead of their time – as well as the famous Great Pyramids</li> \n   <li>The Ancient Egyptians were experts at farming and construction</li> \n   <li>They invented a solar calendar, and one of the world’s earliest writing systems: The hieroglyph</li> \n   <li>The Egyptians were ruled by kings and queens called pharaohs</li> \n   <li>Religion and the afterlife were a huge part of Ancient Egyptian culture. They had over 2,000 gods</li> \n   <li>Pharaohs built huge elaborate tombs to be buried in, some of which were pyramids – at the time among the largest buildings in the world</li> \n   <li>The Egyptians believed in life after death, and important people’s corpses were mummified to preserve their bodies for the afterlife</li> \n   <li>The Ancient Egytpian empire fell due to a mix of factors, including wars with other empires and a 100-year period of drought and starvation</li> \n  </ul> \n </div> \n</div> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\"> \n <div style=\"padding-top: 56%; \"> \n  <video data-video-id=\"6162356327001\" data-account=\"5067014667001\" data-player=\"default\" <!-- .swiper-container --> \n   </div>\n   <!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} --> \n  </div>\n  <!-- .col .sun-col-6 --> \n </div>\n <!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>In other news, a miner in Africa has <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12483104/carat-diamond-africa-world-largest/\">found a 442-carat diamond</a> that could be worth up to $18million (£13.7million).</p> \n<p>The last meal of a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12453878/ancient-sea-monster-lizard-in-stomach-fossil/\">240million year old sea monster</a> has been revealed by archaeologists.</p> \n<p>And, the earliest art ever <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12444862/britain-earliest-art-ice-age-artwork/\">created on the British Isles</a> has been discovered – dating as far back as 23,000 years ago.</p> \n<p>What are your thoughts on the ancient animal cemetery? Let us know in the comments…</p> \n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" /> \n<p><strong>We pay for your stories! Do you have a story for The Sun Online Tech &amp; Science team? Email us at <a href=\"mailto:tech@thesun.co.uk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">tech@the-sun.co.uk</a></strong></p> \n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005866.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"37126c556ae7c6fe389a2f7fad3f860a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn89@2020_1/2020/08/25/11-06-25-295_953f20393ff88527.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":621,"sourceBytes":85584,"destBytes":85584,"author":"Charlotte Edwards","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005866.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn89@2020_1/2020/08/25/11-06-25-295_953f20393ff88527.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005870.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn85@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-44-432_fc1c991747f83c2a.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005878.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn41@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-45-832_2309c8dca76ff154.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005865.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn17@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-45-661_9fa08a5658138972.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604005877.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn99@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-32-541_20cfa310f307e362.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/All_Gizah_Pyramids.jpg?strip=all&&w=620&&h=413&&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn86@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-44-007_31688388109c82d4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584689},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Premier League Fantasy Football: How Jadon Sancho could star for Man Utd next season","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/dream-team/fantasy-football/12307846/premier-league-fantasy-football-jadon-sancho-man-utd/","description":"<p>FANTASY football fans will be desperate to see Manchester United snap up Jadon Sancho this summer.</p>\n<p>The English superstar &#8211; who&#8217;s valued at £110million by Borussia Dortmund &#8211; is edging closer by the day to a move to Old Trafford and he&#8217;s sure to be an exciting addition to next season&#8217;s Dream Team game.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12311849\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-12311849 size-thesun-article-image\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000580017071.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure></p>\n<h2>What could Jadon Sancho bring to your fantasy football team?</h2>\n<p>We&#8217;ve had all of the speculation and hearsay &#8211; from discussions about Sancho&#8217;s wages to whether or not he&#8217;d wear the iconic No.7 shirt at United.</p>\n<p>But the only thing fans of Dream Team want to know is when we&#8217;ll sign &#8211; and what he could bring to fantasy football and the Premier League next season.</p>\n<p>Sancho is certainly a talent; last term he notched 19 goals and 18 assists across the Bundesliga and Champions League, and using WhoScored&#8217;s rating&#8217;s system we&#8217;ve worked out he would&#8217;ve finished the season with <strong>253 points</strong> on Dream Team.</p>\n<p>To put that into context, only Raheem Sterling and Kevin De Bruyne notched more points than Sancho by the end of the season, with Mohamed Salah just behind him with 251 points.</p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Why you should play Dream Team this season</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content-img\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ake-dtfc.jpg?strip=all&&w=620&&h=413&&crop=1\" width=\"620\" height=\"413\" />\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t</p>\n<ul>\n<li>It&#8217;s <strong>completely free</strong> to play</li>\n<li>Play the tradtional <strong>Season</strong> game as well as <strong>Draft</strong></li>\n<li>There&#8217;s a <strong>hefty jackpot</strong> up for grabs across 2020/21</li>\n<li><a data-mce-href=\"https://bit.ly/32q1tWy\" href=\"https://bit.ly/32q1tWy\"><strong>SIGN UP TO PLAY HERE</strong></a></li>\n</ul>\n\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12311853\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-12311853 size-thesun-article-image\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000580016982.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>While we&#8217;re not too sure how much Sancho will be priced on Dream Team this season just yet &#8211; he hasn&#8217;t even moved to the Man United at this point &#8211; we can still have fun speculating while using other, similar players as a rough guideline.</p>\n<p>Sterling, for example, started last season at £6.5m and was a midfielder, while Salah was slightly more expensive at £7.5m and was a striker.</p>\n<p>However, as Sancho is unproven in the Premier League, he might start out a little bit cheaper than Sterling&#8217;s price, while my best guess is that he&#8217;ll be down as a midfielder on the game &#8211; similar to Sterling, Sadio Mane and Eden Hazard before.</p>\n<h2>When does fantasy football start for the new season?</h2>\n<p>We anticipate that registration for Dream Team will open around <strong>mid-August </strong>&#8211; I know, it&#8217;s a quick turnaround!</p>\n<p>It’s completely free to play as ever and there’ll be a hefty jackpot up for grabs.</p>\n<p>The season itself will start on <strong>September 12th</strong>.</p>\n<hr />\n<p>\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail -->\n\n\t\t</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 10:39:43 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000580017071.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"5dfcd97164466c049bc2c14474249362","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn45@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-26-535_98eaa51d7af634b3.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":161426,"destBytes":161426,"author":"mgolson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000580017071.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn45@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-26-535_98eaa51d7af634b3.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ake-dtfc.jpg?strip=all&&w=620&&h=413&&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn53@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-41-823_c291cf6c240b3634.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000580016982.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn2@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-43-755_d6dfa35ecb08ad32.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584671},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Golden State Killer, 74, seen exercising in cell and climbing on furniture – before looking frail for court appearances","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491536/golden-state-killer-exercising-cell-climbing-furniture-frail-court/","description":"<p>SHOCKING footage shows the Golden State Killer exercising and climbing on furniture in his cell at the same time he was appearing in court in a wheelchair. </p>\n<p>Joseph DeAngelo Jr, 74, was last week handed multiple life sentences without the possibility of parole after being convicted for a string of rapes and murders committed in California between 1976 and 1986. </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491520\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/Screenshot-2020-08-25-at-09.05.06.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491520\" width=\"960\" height=\"650\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Joseph DeAngelo Jr is seen clambering onto a high sill in his cell</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491523\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/Screenshot-2020-08-25-at-09.03.11.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491523\" width=\"960\" height=\"672\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">He was also recorded lifting his arms above his head for exercise</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491527\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603327306.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491527\" width=\"960\" height=\"684\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>The Mega Agency</figcredit></figure>Throughout his trial, he appeared in a wheelchair[/caption]</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12491528\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603473483.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491528\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure>A sheriff&#8217;s deputy wipes her eyes while listening to victim statements[/caption]</p>\n<p>DeAngelo, a former police officer, was arrested in April 2018 after DNA evidence was used along with a genealogy database to link him to the crimes decades after they were committed. </p>\n<p>In June, he admitted to 13 counts of first-degree murder in a deal intended to avoid the death penalty.</p>\n<p>He is also believed to be responsible for dozens of other rapes and burglaries. </p>\n<p>Following his arrest, DeAngelo frequently appeared at court hearings looking frail and confused and being pushed in a wheelchair, an appearance he maintained throughout his trial. </p>\n<p>But footage released by prosecutors after his sentencing shows him walking freely around his cell, even clambering onto a high sill above his bed. </p>\n<p>He is also seen lifting his foam mattress and moving it across his cell, lifting his arms above his head for exercise, and using cardboard to meticulously block out a light and make his cell darker. </p>\n<p>Sacramento County District Attorney Anne Marie Schubert said the videos illustrated that DeAngelo was not the person he had sought to present himself as during his trial. </p>\n<p>&#8220;When you look back in time four decades, and you now stand in the presence of 2020, you can see that Joseph DeAngelo is no different today than when he was 45 years ago,&#8221; she said. </p>\n<p>&#8220;[The videos] simply demonstrate&#8230; his mental acuity, his dexterity, his ability to deceive or attempt to deceive the entire world into believing he is a feeble old man. </p>\n<p>&#8220;These are just snippets into the window of the mind of a sociopath. </p>\n<p>&#8220;He is, quite simply, the definition of one. He has and always will be a sociopath in action.&#8221;</p>\n<p>After listening silently to witness testimony and shortly before being sentenced on Friday, DeAngelo stood and told the court: &#8220;I&#8217;ve listened to all of your statements. Each one of them. And I&#8217;m really sorry for everyone I&#8217;ve hurt.&#8221;</p>\n<p>The sentencing took place in a university ballroom because a normal courtroom would have been too small to accommodate the many victims and victims&#8217; families who wanted to attend. </p>\n<p>The sentences DeAngelo received mean he will almost certainly die in prison. </p>\n<p>\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div arrested","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12492556/boy-dies-crash-newcastle/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A FIVE-YEAR-OLD boy has died after being hit by a van in a Newcastle street as a man has been arrested.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police raced the residential street at 4.50pm yesterday responding to calls about a collision involving a Ford Transit van and a child.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492585\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NCJM_Willow-Avenue-01-copy.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=300&#38;h=192&#38;crop=1\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone wp-image-12492585\" /><figcaption alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492967\" width=\"960\" height=\"714\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ncjMedia</figcredit></figure>Police raced to the scene on Monday evening in Newcastle [/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492997\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604014033.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492997\" width=\"960\" height=\"583\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ncjMedia</figcredit></figure>A 38-year-old man has been arrested in connection to the collision[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Emergency services attended and the boy was taken to the Royal Victoria Infirmary where he sadly died.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The white van was towing a trailer with a digger on it at the time of<br>the collision.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A 38-year-old man has been arrested in connection and remains in police custody at this time.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Detectives are appealing for any witnesses to the collision to come forward to help with their investigation.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It is believed a taxi was in the area at the time. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sergeant Raymond Lowery, of Northumbria Police’s Motor Patrols<br>Department, said: “This collision has devastatingly resulted in the<br>death of a five-year-old child.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Our thoughts are with the young boy’s family at this incredibly<br>difficult time and they will continue to be supported by our<br>specialist officers.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“This is clearly a tragic time for them and I would ask that their<br>privacy be respected.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“An investigation has been launched and we are committed to<br>establishing the circumstances surrounding this incident.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I am now appealing to any road users who were travelling in the area<br>around that time to come forward with any information or dashcam<br>footage.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“From CCTV, we understand a taxi was in the area at the time and the<br>driver may have seen the van prior to the collision so we are<br>particularly keen for them to &#8220;monster&#8221; by his former coach &#8211; who likened him to Virgil van Dijk and Raphael Varane. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 6ft 4in Frenchman was signed by the Gunners last season <a src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/GettyImages-962751286.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491720\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images </figcredit></figure>Saliba&#8217;s playing style has been compared to Raphael Varane and Virgil van Dijk[/caption]\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h3><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12116744/arsenal-transfer-news-live-willian-aubameyang-partey/\"><strong>ARSENAL NEWS LIVE: Click here for the latest Gunners news</strong></a></h3>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<p>&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Having impressed again in Ligue 1, the 19-year-old has since <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12433785/william-saliba-pressure-arsenal-team-keown-warning/\">linked up with his Arsenal team-mates ahead of the new season.</a> </p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Saliba&#8217;s physical presence has been hailed by his ex-French youth coach Jean-Luc Vannuchi &#8211; who was left stunned by the defender. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Vannuchi told&#160;<a rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2020/08/24/making-william-saliba-talent-generation-ready-make-mark-arsenal/\">The Telegraph</a>: &#8220;My first impression was that this was the biggest man of his generation. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The difference between him and the other players was massive.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;When he took the ball and ran into midfield, no one could stop him. He was like a monster compared to the others. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;When he played with St-Etienne it looked normal for him, even though he was so young.&#8221; </p>\n\n\n\n<p>His playing style has been compared to Real Madrid&#8217;s Varane and Liverpool star Van Dijk. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Vannuchi said: &#8220;A mix of the two styles.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;With Varane because of his speed and power, and with Van Dijk it is the interceptions, the positioning on the pitch.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12490696/arsenal-transfer-gabriel-magalhaes-agent/\">Saliba will be joined by Brazilian Gabriel Magalhaes</a>, who snubbed &#8220;more lucrative offers&#8221; to join Arsenal. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 22-year-old Lille centre-half is on the verge of moving to the Emirates in a £25million deal with Mikel Arteta&#8217;s defensive revolution nearly complete.</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SPORTS-GRAPHIC-EXPENSIVE-SIGNINGS-ARSENAL.jpg\"><img 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Formula One confirms final four races of 2020 season with Turkish GP returning for first time in nine years","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/motorsport/12492844/f1-turkey-2020-bahrain-abu-dhabi/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>FORMULA ONE has announced a return to Turkey as it completes a 17-race season in the Middle East.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Istanbul Park will host its first Grand Prix in nine years this winter before a double-header in Bahrain and season-closer in Abu Dhabi.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492884\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000544209027.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492884\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AP:Associated Press</figcredit></figure>Abu Dhabi&#8217;s Yas Marina Circuit will host the 17th and final race of the 2020 calendar[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>On Tuesday, F1 announced how it will cap off a wholly unique 2020 calendar with four final races.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Istanbul Park, located an hour east of Turkey&#8217;s bustling capital, is based in a secluded location that will help the sport maintain its stringent coronavirus protocols.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Likewise, Bahrain and Abu Dhabi are both common fixtures on the F1 circuit with the former&#8217;s <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/motorsport/11164628/f1-bahrain-gp-coronavirus-horner/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">March race cancelled as the pandemic began</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The announcement confirms the 2020 campaign will take place exclusively in Europe and the Middle East, with no trips to the Americas or Far East.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>October races at Germany&#8217;s Nurburgring and iconic Italian track Imola will complete the European stint before the trip across the Bosporus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ailing Ferrari driver Sebastian Vettel may not be fancying another go around Istanbul Park, which was the home of his infamous crash with Red Bull teammate Mark Webber in 2010.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending government funding awarded to the track saw it slip off the calendar.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Last year&#8217;s Bahrain and Abu Dhabi GPs were both won by Mercedes ace Hamilton, who leads the current championship rankings by 37 points.</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/CM-GRAPHIC-F1-v4.jpg\"><img 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Arsenal transfer of £27m Roma star Amadou Diawara edges near as Serie A side eager to sell to fund own spending spree","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12491808/arsenal-transfer-roma-amadou-diawara/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>ARSENAL are edging closer to signing £27million Roma midfielder Amadou Diawara, according to reports.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Serie A side are keen to offload some stars in order to fund their own spending spree and the Ghanaian is one they are reportedly happy to let go.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491824\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12491787.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491824\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Arsenal are edging closer to signing Roma midfielder Amadou Diawara</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Mikel Arteta&#8217;s No1 midfield target was Atletico Madrid&#8217;s Thomas Partey but <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12477204/arsenal-thomas-partey-transfer-atletico-madrid-release-clause/\">the North Londoners are unwilling to to meet his £45m release clause</a>. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>But he could now turn his attention to holding midfielder Diawara, 23, with Roma willing to sell, according to the <a href=\"https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1327027/Arsenal-Mikel-Arteta-Boost-Amadou-Diawara-Roma-Premier-League-Transfer-News\">Express</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They have already <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12353627/pedro-announces-chelsea-departure-instagram-farewell/\">landed ex-Chelsea winger Pedro</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h3><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12116744/arsenal-transfer-news-live-willian-aubameyang-partey/\"><strong>ARSENAL NEWS LIVE: Click here for the latest Gunners news</strong></a></h3>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<p>&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Manchester United&#8217;s <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12443100/arsenal-sokratis-roma-transfer-smalling/\">Chris Smalling and Arsenal&#8217;s Sokratis are said to be high on the Italians&#8217; wishlist</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And they were even linked with a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12411827/arsenal-torreira-swap-roma-midfielder-diawara/\">swap deal with the Gunners involving Diawara and Lucas Torreira. </a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Diawara &#8211; who played 30 games in all competitions during the 2019/20 season &#8211; only joined Roma from Napoli last summer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But he could be on the way to the Emirates for the same fee the North Londoners are set to pay for Lille defender Gabriel Magalhaes. </p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>The <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12483430/gabriel-magalhaes-lands-in-london-arsenal-transfer-man-utd/\">Brazilian centre-half landed in London yesterday to complete the deal</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And he went straight to the Gunners&#8217; Colney training base to complete a medical which he passed.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Arsenal are expected to announce the signing imminently.  </p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Arsenal-Top-Fixtures-2.jpg\"><img -->\n\n\t\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 09:51:52 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12491787.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"efc625ac5dbcee3dc019dabf994e0c7e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-113_f05d027305f24f21.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":142310,"destBytes":142310,"author":"William Pugh","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12491787.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-113_f05d027305f24f21.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Arsenal-Top-Fixtures-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn4@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-29-355_8873eb7225d10739.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584754},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Tenerife and Lanzarote forced to call extra police as illegal parties risk further Spanish holiday island outbreaks","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12492028/tenerife-lanzarote-police-parties-canary-islands/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>THE Canary Islands are calling in extra police amid concerns over the rising number of coronavirus cases and the flouting of safety rules, including illegal parties and people ignoring the face mask rules.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The regional government is asking the security forces to step up controls on all the islands, which includes Tenerife, Lanzarote and Gran Canaria, the latter of which has the highest number of cases.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492363\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/police-step-up-patrols-in-Canary-Islands.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492363\" width=\"960\" height=\"720\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">More police are being called across the Canary Islands as people flout the face mask and party rules</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Yesterday, the owners of a pleasure boat were warned of a £5,500 fine for holding an onboard party in Mogan, in the south-west of Gran Canaria, where many of the guests were not wearing masks or observing social distancing. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Two other parties advertised on the social networks were also banned.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Spain has 420,809 overall cases, the highest in Europe, while the Canaries have had nearly 5,000 since the crisis began.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Health chiefs say there have been 2,031 infections in the last 15 days, representing a cumulative incidence of 94.32 cases diagnosed per 100,000 inhabitants, while in the last seven days there are 1,282 cases in the islands, with an incidence of 59.53.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Both of these put the islands well over the UK&#8217;s rate of 20 &#8211; countries above this are at risk of being put onto the quarantine list.</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/RR-TABLE-EUROPE-CORONAVIRUS-CASES-24-AUGV2-1.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/RR-TABLE-EUROPE-CORONAVIRUS-CASES-24-AUGV2-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=754\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large wp-image-12484256\" width=\"754\" height=\"1024\" /></a>\n\n\n\n<p>Canary president, Ángel Víctor Torres yesterday chaired a meeting of the emergency committee when it was agreed to &#8220;strengthen the staff of the state security forces and increase surveillance to prevent contagions.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Canary Islands are battling to get British holidaymakers back and to persuade the UK government to <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/politics/12461240/islands-canary-ibiza-mallorca-quarantine-list-regional/\">lift its 14-day quarantine ban</a> when they return from Spain.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But efforts are being hampered by new outbreaks of coronavirus. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>One of the latest is on the quiet island of El Hierro where 30 people have been isolated whilst awaiting test results following their contact with two positives.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In the space of 24 hours from Sunday to Monday, the Canaries registered 136 new cases and there has been one new death in the last week, bringing the total to 168 since the pandemic began in Spain.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492567\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601780490-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492567\" width=\"960\" height=\"634\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Reuters</figcredit></figure>Gran Canaria has seen the highest cases in the Canary Islands[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Of the new positive cases within one day, Gran Canaria accounted for 89, followed by Tenerife (29),  Lanzarote (15), Fuerteventura (one) and El Hierro (four).</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This is also a severe setback for the tourist interests of the archipelago as 50 was the window set as the &#8220;safe point&#8221; by several countries wanting to send tourists to the islands.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Thousands of coronavirus tests are being carried out throughout the Canaries which will have contributed to the increased figures and nearly 160 trackers are working to find contacts with all new positive cases.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But island leaders are expressing concerns that not everyone is sticking to the rules and wants to clampdown on people <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12421177/tenerife-lanzarote-gran-canaria-beach-face-masks/\">who don&#8217;t wear masks</a>, flout social distancing and insist on attending illegal parties. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Canaries have also adopted new rules with effect from August 14 which are being applied across Spain. </p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12401882/tenerife-lanzarote-smoking-ban-face-masks-clubs-canary-islands/\">These include</a> the closure of all nightclubs and 1am curfews for pubs and restaurants, together with a ban on smoking in public place unless a distance of two metres can be guaranteed.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-travel\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">Most read in News class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12443699/france-spain-portugal-quarantine-travel-coronavirus/\" class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tLatest travel advice for Greece including quarantine rules and flights\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12235771/greece-holiday-latest-travel-quarantine-coronavirus/\" .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Police in the tourist south of Tenerife have already been stepping up night-time patrols, especially on a Friday and Saturday in nightlife areas. Last weekend, 22 premises were reported for not complying with coronavirus safety rules.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And in the north of the island in the capital of Santa Cruz, dozens of fines are being handed out for non-compliance of the mask regulations.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Canary Islands have been pressing for months for coronavirus tests to be carried out on tourists before they leave the airport in their own country and on arrival at their destination and hoteliers even offered to pay.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; Godfrey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/police-step-up-patrols-in-Canary-Islands.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn49@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-25-371_54e6a8053fc530a3.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/RR-TABLE-EUROPE-CORONAVIRUS-CASES-24-AUGV2-1.jpg?strip=all&w=754":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn1@2020_3/2020/08/25/11-06-36-210_81ff6b7f69b3dd6a.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601780490-1.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn43@2020_1/2020/08/25/11-06-29-985_d0d165fa353b5b5b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584671},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Jacob Blake’s neighbour so traumatised he can’t sleep after filming black dad being shot seven times by white cop","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491768/jacob-blakes-neighbour-traumatised-filming-shooting/","description":"<p>THE neighbor of Jacob Blake has said he is so traumatised after filming the man being shot he can&#8217;t sleep.</p>\n<p>Raysean White captured the moment white cops emptied an estimated seven shots into the 29-year-old <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/us-news/1358677/jacob-blake-shot-kenosha/\">Blake&#8217;s</a> back as his petrified <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1362069/jacob-blakes-fiancee-shot-kids-screaming-wisconsin/\">children watched on from the car. </a></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603775882.jpg?w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Mr White captured the viral footage</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/Screenshot-2020-08-24-at-12.00.31.png?w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">An officer can be seen following Mr Blake, pointing a gun at him</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/AD-PIC-Child-Muzz.jpg?w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The 29-year-old dad-of-three was shot in front of his kids</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>Mr White, who chose not to appear on television or be photographed, described the situation as &#8220;highly disturbing&#8221;. </p>\n<p>Speaking to CNN, he said: &#8220;It&#8217;s disturbing to actually look out the window where I live and see this man get shot by the police seven times.</p>\n<p>&#8220;It&#8217;s highly disturbing to me, but I&#8217;m pretty sure Jacob&#8217;s kids were more traumatized than anybody during the whole situation.&#8221;</p>\n<p>He added he had struggled to sleep since <a href=\"https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/news/5964479/wisconsin-white-police-shoot-black-unarmed-man-kids/\">capturing the footage</a> Sunday evening.</p>\n<p>Mr White captured the cell phone footage of the incident which quickly went viral, sparking another wave of Black Lives Matter protests.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1363690/kenosha-protests-jacob-blake-fire-cars/\">Riots were seen in the mens&#8217; home city of Kenosha, Wisconsin last night and Sunday </a>with cars and buildings torched to the ground and furious face-offs between protesters and police.</p>\n<p>In the distressing footage, Jacob Blake can be seen walking towards a car followed by two officers, who say they were responding to a &#8220;domestic incident&#8221;.</p>\n<p>As Mr Blake turns inwards to the car door, an officer grabs the back of his shirt and seven shots can be heard ringing out.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603834933.jpg?w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The neighbour said he is so traumatised by the incident he can&#8217;t sleep</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603775884.jpg?w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Seven shots can be heard ringing out as a woman screams</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603941648.jpg?w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The shooting has sparked riots in Wisconsin</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>During the shooting, a black woman can be seen screaming in the street and jumping up and down.</p>\n<p>Mr White has said the dad had intended to break up an argument between two women when he was shot.</p>\n<p>He added: &#8220;We don&#8217;t want [police] around because we are scared for our lives. </p>\n<p>&#8220;You come to an incident to disarm an argument, and this Black man gets shot. It wasn&#8217;t supposed to go down that.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Mr White explained how the incident unfolded, with Mr Blake allegedly telling his son to get inside his vehicle as he investigated the women&#8217;s disagreement. </p>\n<p>But when the neighbour looked out of the window again he saw cops had arrived and were &#8220;wrestling&#8221; with Mr Blake.</p>\n<p>He said one officer had Blake in a headlock and was punching his ribs before a female officer tased him, at which point Mr White began recording. </p>\n<p>Immediately after the shooting the neighbour said he saw the cop trying to help Mr Blake, who was rushed to hospital and is currently fighting for his life. </p>\n<p>\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tDeath penalty of husband who slayed pregnant wife on Xmas Eve is overturned\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12488371/scott-peterson-death-penalty-overturned-laci-peterson/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t</p>\n<p>The Wisconsin Division of Criminal Investigation will investigate the shooting and take the findings to District Attorney Michael D. Graveley while the officers involved have been placed on administrative leave. </p>\n<p>Mr Blake is being represented by lawyer Benjamin Crump, who is also spearheading the George Floyd case. </p>\n<p>DA Graveley has said the investigation is still in &#8220;its earliest stages.&#8221;</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img fighting for his life</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Catherine Tyldesley to front new ITV drama Viewpoint tracking voyeurs and undercover police in Manchester","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12492014/catherine-tyldesley-itv-drama-viewpoint-undercover-police-manchester/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>CATHERINE Tyldesley is set to front a new ITV drama called Viewpoint that tracks voyeurs and undercover police in Manchester.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The gripping five-part drama follows a tense surveillance investigation into a tight knit community and explores whether it is ever possible to observe the lives of others with true objectivity and zero effect.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492805\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 525px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000575066719.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=515\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492805\" width=\"515\" height=\"643\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Instagram</figcredit></figure>The actress will be in the new ITV drama[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The all-star cast features recognisable faces including Bulletproof’s Noel Clarke, No Offence’s Alexandra Roach and Corrie’s very own Catherine Tyldesley.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The show is based on an idea by Fleabag and Emmy award-winning director, Harry Bradbeer [Killing Eve, No Offence] and co-created and written by Edgar award-winner Ed Whitmore [Safe House, Manhunt].</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Clarke plays surveillance detective, DC Martin King, who sets up his observation post in the home of single mum and secret voyeur, Zoe Sterling, played by Roach.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>From Zoe’s window there is a panoramic view of Westbury Square, and more importantly provides a direct sightline into the home of missing primary school teacher, Gemma Hillman.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492848\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/c5790b80-bae7-4578-9821-3d3f214627b8.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492848\" width=\"960\" height=\"607\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>Catherine played Eva in Coronation Street[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Head of Drama, Tiger Aspect Productions and Executive Producer, Lucy Bedford said: “Harry and Ed have crafted a compelling, tense, claustrophobic thriller that turns the spotlight on the observer rather than the observed. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;With the incredible Noel Clarke and Alexandra Roach leading the cast, we are extremely excited to be back in production.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Filming has begun in Manchester and is the first ITV drama to begin filming since all UK production went into lockdown due to Coronavirus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Catherine, who played Cobbles barmaid Eva Price, has been making best use of her time away from screen amid the coronavirus pandemic with some home renovation.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492842\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000167539640.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492842\" width=\"960\" wait to share her ultra trendy space with her Instagram followers, posting a selection of snaps in which she confessed she is &#8220;beyond thrilled with our new bathroom.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Catherine, 36, who is married to Tom Pitfield, has been showing off her home including shower space, complete with a black-framed separator and marble-effect tiles covering the walls.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>While the sink and toilet are a crisp, clean white, other fittings such as the loo roll holder and taps stand out in gold.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A huge circular mirror above died","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12491282/eastenders-linda-henry-holiday-cheryl-fergison/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>EASTENDERS star Linda Henry has revealed that she still goes on holiday with onscreen best friend Cheryl Fergison. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The actress &#8211; who has played Shirley Carter on the BBC soap since 2006 &#8211; formed a strong bond with her co-star and still sees her despite the fact Heather was killed off by Ben Mitchell eight years ago.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491584\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604000127.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491584\" width=\"960\" height=\"782\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>EastEnders&#8217; Linda Henry reveals she still goes on holiday with onscreen best friend Cheryl Fergison &#8211; eight years after Heather Trott&#8217;s death[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Last night Linda was joined by her on-screen sister Tina, who is played by Luisa Bradshaw-White, on Stacey Dooley&#8217;s EastEnders: Secrets From The Square.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>During the 30 minute programme, the pair reminisced over their time on the soap with various clips of scenes with a number of different actors they&#8217;ve worked with. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Linda got emotional when the trio rewatched a clip of Shirley and &#8216;Hev&#8217; dancing around in the Laundrette with Pat Butcher&#8217;s underwear on. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>When the camera panned back on her in the studio, Linda said: &#8220;Broke my heart when they got rid of Cheryl.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491589\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 550px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603996528.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=540\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491589\" width=\"540\" height=\"359\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>BBC</figcredit></figure>Linda and Cheryl got up to some right mischief together on the show[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491605\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 654px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604000128-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=644\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491605\" width=\"644\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>The two still spend a lot of time together, despite not working with each other [/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>As they all giggled away about the scene, the soap star reassured fans that they still are very much friends despite not working with each other any more. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>She added: &#8220;We still see each other, we go on holiday with each other, every day was a lovely day at work with her.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Linda&#8217;s best pal, Heather, died in March 2012 when she was accidentally killed by Ben Mitchell.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ben hit her on the head with a picture frame, causing her to call back and hit her head on her kitchen counter.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491586\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 550px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603996530.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=540\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491586\" width=\"540\" height=\"292\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>BBC</figcredit></figure>Heather was killed by Ben Mitchell in 2012[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491585\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000000612238.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491585\" width=\"640\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Handout</figcredit></figure>Cheryl has not been in EastEnders for eight years now[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Jay Brown was there too and – along with Ben’s dad Phil – helped to cover up the crime.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He eventually went to juvenile detention for the crime but Shirley – who used to be his stepmother – has never forgiven him.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The George Michael fan left behind her son George, who was named after her favourite singer. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Shirley was given the role as one of his godparents and looked after the tot until he eventually went to live with his dad Darren Miller. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491583\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 653px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604000129.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=643\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491583\" width=\"643\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>Linda with her onscreen sister who is played by Luisa Bradshaw-White[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Viewers were also taken a back when Linda broke down in tears about not being able to see her grandson during lockdown. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 57-year-old is famed for playing the hardfaced, tough nut Walford resident &#8211; and fans couldn&#8217;t believe how different she is in real life.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Stacey asked: &#8220;What have you been doing in lockdown?&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Linda replied: &#8220;I&#8217;ve just been at home, I live with my husband and my dog Johnny.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491766\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000000271908-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491766\" width=\"960\" height=\"672\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Handout</figcredit></figure>Shirley Cater is known for her stand-offish exterior[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Her voice then notably cracked as she continued: &#8220;And really wishing &#8211; my grandson… I just really…&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As well as not being able to see her family, Linda and the rest of the cast were told not to go into work to try and help stop the spread of the deadly bug. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Back in March, producers of the soap cancelled filming due to the coronavirus pandemic and cut down to two episodes a week. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Filming&#160;started back up again on June 29, more than three months after lockdown forced a pause in production.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>The number of weekly episodes were then slashed in an effort to keep the show on air for as long as possible.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But the final pre-lockdown episode aired on June 16,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11877297/eastenders-last-episode-tonight-run-out-episodes/\">forcing the soap to go off air for the first time in its 35-year history</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Although fans of the show won&#8217;t have to wait much longer as it has been revealed that&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12393363/bbc-confirms-eastenders-return-screens-september-7-12-weeks-off-air/\">EastEnders will officially be back&#160;</a>on Monday, September 7.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>From then on, the soap will be airing four nights a week at the slightly shorter length of twenty minutes.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Who plays Debbie Webster in Coronation Street?","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12492395/coronation-street-who-plays-debbie-webster-sue-devaney/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>DEBBIE Webster will return to Coronation Street this Wednesday (August 26) for the first time in over three decades and shake things up on the cobbles.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>So who plays Debbie Webster and why is she <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12422204/coronation-street-spoilers-debbie-webster-abi-franklin-clash-kevin/\">returning an incredible 35 years after her first stint on the ITV soap</a>? Here’s the lowdown&#8230;</p>\n\n\n\n<ul><li><strong>Visit our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronation-street/\">Coronation Street</a> page for the latest gossip </strong></li><li><strong>Find all <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/emmerdale-spoilers/\">Coronation Street spoilers</a> here</strong></li></ul>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492686\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 634px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601171121.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=624\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492686\" width=\"624\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Sue Devaney is returning to Corrie 35 years after her first stint on the soap</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<h2>Who plays Debbie Webster in Coronation Street?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Debbie Webster is played by English actress Sue Devaney.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Born July 2, 1967, Sue is a familiar face from the world of British television.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As well as Coronation Street, the actress has starred in a number of shows over the years including Johnny Briggs, Casualty and Dinnerladies.&#160;&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The actress is also known for treading the boards and her theatre work includes When We Are Married, The Wind in the Willows and The Land of the Living.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking about returning to the cobbles, the actress told <a href=\"https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/coronation-street-return-sue-devaney-22536795\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">The Mirror</a>: “I got all the nerves you get starting a new job, like the first day at school but once I got there it was lovely. I thought I would be nervous playing a character I played when I was 16 and I am now 53, but it was just so easy and I loved it.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“There is something about soap that I love so I feel very lucky, and with what is going on at the moment, to have a job I feel blessed.”</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492689\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000600334706.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492689\" width=\"960\" height=\"542\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Debbie Webster returned briefly last year to tell Kevin he&#8217;d inherited some money</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<h2>Why is Debbie returning to Coronation Street?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Debbie made a brief return last year but <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12335336/coronation-street-abi-franklin-drugs-horror-relapse/\">now is set for a more permanent comeback</a>. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking about her character&#8217;s return, Debbie actress Sue Devaney told <a href=\"https://metro.co.uk/2020/08/21/coronation-street-spoilers-sue-devaney-reveals-huge-drama-debbie-abi-13149281/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Metro.co.uk</a>: &#8220;I think business has brought her back and I think, because the situation where she lives in Turkey, she was missing her family, she’s very close to her brother and I think she wanted to be around family more.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I think you do get to that age in life where you think “I’ve had all this, I wanna get closer to home” and I think the thing with Debbie is, wherever she travels and whatever she does, she always comes back to home. She’s never forgotten where she’s come from.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;She takes comfort in that and, this time round, she thinks &#8216;I quite like it here&#8217;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I think she’s going to do a few business deals and stuff and she wants to make sure her brother is all right.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492695\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000524709604-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492695\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>Debbie will lock horns with Kevin&#8217;s girlfriend Abi in Corrie[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>Why did Debbie leave Coronation Street?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Debbie left the soap in 1985 after seven months in Weatherfield.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div
