src=\"https://players.brightcove.net/5067014667001/default_default/index.min.js\"></script>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\n\t\t<!-- End of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 10:44:15 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601778442.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"00c921a5de75e9b219d201c97efda497","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/25/11-06-25-230_1ab0250839001926.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":42246,"destBytes":42246,"author":"Dave Fraser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601778442.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/25/11-06-25-230_1ab0250839001926.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584701},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"The 6 deadliest cancers in the UK revealed – and the signs you should never ignore","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491166/6-deadliest-cancers-uk-3-signs-never-ignore/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>SIX deadly cancers are causing 67,000 deaths a year in the UK, experts have revealed.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Charities are now calling for more investment in order to speed up cancer detection and diagnosis after it was found that &#8220;less survivable cancers&#8221; make up half of all common cancer deaths in the UK.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-CANCER-TABLE.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-CANCER-TABLE.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491316\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /></a>\n\n\n\n<p>Data from the the Less Survivable Cancers Taskforce (LSCT) found that lung cancer was the deadliest in the UK, followed by brain, head and neck tumours, pancreatic cancer, oesophageal cancer, stomach cancer and liver cancer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The report found that just one third of patients diagnosed with one of these cancers will be diagnosed after an emergency admission to hospital.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This included when symptoms included coughing up blood or vomiting.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>LSCT says this accounts for thousands of &#8220;catastrophic prognoses&#8221; for thousands of people each year.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But how can you spot if you have signs of one of the six deadliest cancers and what are the symptoms you should never ignore?</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>1. Lung cancer</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>The report states that lung cancer is the most common cancer in the world and in the UK 35,300 people die from the illness every year, while 47,800 people are diagnosed per year.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Smoking is the leading cause of lung cancer, but it is not the only cause and 28 per cent of cases are not caused by smoking.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It does however mean that smokers and ex-smokers have an increased risk.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Lung cancer develops when the growth of abnormal cells starts in one or both lungs. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Healthy cells are needed to develop into healthy lung tissue and the abnormal cells are not able to carry out this function.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>What to look out for?</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The key symptoms of lung cancer include a cough that does not go away or gets worse, coughing up blood, weight loss and loss of appetite and feeling tired or weak.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>You may also experience a chest pain which is worse when you breath deeply, hoarseness and shortness of breath.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491877\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000536085394.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491877\" width=\"960\" height=\"641\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty - Contributor</figcredit></figure>Symptoms of lung cancer include a chest pain which is worse when you take deep breaths[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>2. Brain, head and neck tumours</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Brain, head and neck tumours account for 5,300 deaths a year in the UK.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It is the ninth most common cancer in the UK and 60 per cent of those diagnoses with a high-grade tumour will die within a year.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Just 12 per cent will survive for five years or more.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Tumours are a growth of cells that multiple in an uncontrollable way.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>What to look out for?</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Key symptoms include headaches, mental or behavioural changes, vision and speech issues and nausea and vomiting.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491887\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000600644720-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491887\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Consistent headaches are a key symptom of brain tumours [/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>3. Pancreatic cancer</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>In the UK 60 per cent of people with pancreatic cancer are not diagnosed until the cancer is at an advanced stage &#8211; so it&#8217;s important to know the signs.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Less than seven per cent of people with this cancer will survive beyond five years.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Pancreatic cancer is found in the pancreas &#8211; which is the organ in the top part of your stomach which helps you digest food.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>What to look out for?</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>If you are experiencing pain in the stomach or back and unexpected weight loss then you may have pancreatic cancer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Other symptoms include jaundice which is when the skin and the whites of the eyes turn yellow.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491899\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000458730425.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491899\" width=\"960\" height=\"669\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty - Contributor</figcredit></figure>Losing weight without trying is a key symptom of  pancreatic cancer [/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>4. Oesophageal cancer</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Oesophageal cancer impacts the gullet &#8211; which is the long tube that carries food from the throat to the stomach.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Each year in the UK there are around 9,100 cases of this cancer and just 15 per cent of patients survive the cancer for five years or more.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>What to look out for?</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>If you have oesophageal cancer you may experience symptoms such as persistent indigestion or heartburn and you may find it difficult to swallow.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Other symptoms include a loss of appetite and weight loss, vomiting, pain in the stomach, chest or back, persistent cough, tiredness, shortness of breath and hoarseness.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>5. Stomach cancer</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Around 40 per cent of people who develop stomach cancer will survive for one year or more.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This cancer is more common in men than women and 50 per cent of cases occur in people over the age of 75.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Stomach cancer occurs when malignant cells form in the lining of the stomach.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Age and diet are both factors.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>What to look out for?</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Suffering from symptoms such as indigestion, feeling full faster, feeling bloated and feeling sick may mean you have stomach cancer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Other symptoms include difficulty swallowing and stomach pain.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491922\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000454095174-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491922\" width=\"960\" height=\"641\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty - Contributor</figcredit></figure>If you have stomach cancer then you may experience stomach pains [/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>6. Liver cancer</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Liver cancer begins in the cells of your liver &#8211; which is the football sized organ that sits in the upper right portion of your abdomen.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It is the sixth most common cancer and accounts for seven per cent of all cancer deaths.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Deaths from this cancer have soared by 50 per cent in the last ten years.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>What to look out for?</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>If you have liver cancer then you may have symptoms such as swelling in your abdomen, jaundice and itchy skin.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Other symptoms include unintentional weight loss and loss of appetite, feeling full after eating or feeling and being sick.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491943\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000561934256.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491943\" width=\"960\" height=\"643\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>A loss of appetite is a symptom of liver cancer[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>The signs you should never ignore</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>While each individual cancer has specific symptoms to look out for, some symptoms are common across all six deadly cancers.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>There are three symptoms that were found across four of the six most deadliest cancers and these are the ones that you should take extra caution around.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>If you have any of these symptoms then you should visit your GP.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>1. Weight loss and loss of appetite</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>If you have recently experienced unintentional weight loss &#8211; this means when you have lost weight without trying a diet or weight loss plan, then you may have one of the deadly cancers.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As well as this a loss of appetite was also common across various cancers.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A loss of appetite is when you don&#8217;t feel hungry even if you haven&#8217;t been eating at regular intervals.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-news\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div has feature video. -->\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-play theme__background-color-rgba-80\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span></span>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-image -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tMOWED DOWN\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tHeartstopping moment man is sent somersaulting over hedge by &#039;road rage driver&#039;\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12484271/man-sent-flying-hedge-road-rage-driver/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<h2>2. Nausea and vomiting</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Feeling sick or queasy and vomiting without reason are also key symptoms.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>If you are vomiting it may be that you have developed a stomach bug or food poisoning &#8211; but if you have these symptoms then you may want to visit a pharmacist to help with over the counter medication &#8211; which may solve the problem.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But if the symptoms persist it could be a sign of cancer, so you should visit your GP.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>3. Stomach pain </h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Pain in the stomach without explanation is a key symptom.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sometimes if we have allergies then we might experience stomach pain &#8211; so it&#8217;s always good to understand what triggers this pain.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>If the pain is unexplained and is consistent throughout the day then it could be a sign of cancer.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Coronavirus outbreak at Norfolk chicken factory as seven workers struck down with bug","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12490794/coronavirus-outbreak-norfolk-chicken-factory-2/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>SEVEN workers at a chicken factory have tested positive for coronavirus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Five more are waiting for test results after the outbreak at Banham Poultry in Attleborough, Norfolk.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"⚠\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &#38; updates</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491928\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000439269018.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491928\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>SWNS:South West News Service</figcredit></figure>Seven workers have tested positive for coronavirus at a chicken processsing plant in Norfolk[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491287\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/8d50a5b1-74b9-4204-9ec2-d1bd78beec7a.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491287\" width=\"960\" height=\"536\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>The outbreak at Banham Poultry in Attleborough, Norfolk is the latest at a factory[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Production is continuing at the plant, which processes around 650,000 chickens a week at its 12-acre site.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>All seven staff struck down with Covid are self-isolating for 14 days. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The five workers waiting for their results are also isolating as testing of more the workforce of around 600 is carried out as “a precautionary measure”.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Louise Smith, director of public health for Norfolk, said health officials were “monitoring the situation and taking action” to prevent further transmission.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>FACTORY OUTBREAK</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>She said: “We are working with colleagues at Public Health England, the NHS and Breckland Council following an outbreak of&#160;coronavirus&#160;at Banham Poultry in Attleborough.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“The management team at Banham Poultry has acted quickly to help prevent the spread of the virus and is working closely with us to trace the contacts of those who have tested positive.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It&#8217;s the latest food processing plant to report an outbreak, sparking fears over the spread of COVID-19 in chilled factories.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>An outbreak at a chicken factory in Scotland hit more than 150 people with a further 42 positive tests.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>VIRUS SURGE</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>The number of positive <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronavirus/\">Covid-19</a> cases linked to the 2 Sisters food processing plant in Coupar Angus, Perthshire reached 152 &#8211; with 134 employees and 18 of their contacts affected.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As a result of the plant&#8217;s shutdown, 110,000 chickens will be slaughtered, it&#8217;s reported.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Meanwhile, four workers at a medical factory that make products vital in the fight against Covid-19, have tested positive for coronavirus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Becton Dickinson BD (UK) confirmed the four employees had positive tests out of a workforce of 750.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The firm, based at Roborough, near Plymouth, Devon, said half of the workers who had close contact with the affected workers had tested negative with more results pending.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Banham Poultry managing director Blaine van Rensburg said: “The safety of our staff, customers, and the wider public is really important to us.</p>\n\n\n\n<p> &#8220;We are working with public health authorities to make sure we are doing absolutely everything we can and following all of the correct procedures.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div moment man is sent somersaulting over hedge by &#039;road rage driver&#039;\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The business remains open and operating and we are doing everything we can to prevent the further spread of the virus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“We have already invested in a range of procedures and protective equipment to keep our staff as safe as possible.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The processing plant is in Breckland which has just 5.02 cases per 100,000 people, around half the average for for England which has 10.68.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12487641\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603443075.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" slaughtered in the grim operation\" class=\"alignnone\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Officials at the plant say the chickens will be gassed after more than 150 positive coronavirus later","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12491425/usain-bolt-party-positive-coronavirus-raheem-sterling/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>Police are now investigating the surprise party that left Usain Bolt with Covid-19 – as videos showed the sprinter washing himself with champagne at the wild bash.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The eight-time Olympic gold medal winner has been informed that he tested positive for coronavirus, Jamaica’s health minister announced.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"⚠\" class=\"wp-smiley\" rules</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491503\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 395px\"><img height=\"522\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">England&#8217;s Raheem Sterling was seen dancing and chatting with Bolt, who tested positive for Covid-19</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Jamaica’s PM Andrew Holness also revealed that cops are investigating the circumstances surrounding the party – Bolt’s 34th birthday bash – and will release a report on it.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The celebration – held without masks and in spite of the country’s rule of no more than 20 people at public events &#8211; plunged the Three Lions into coronavirus turmoil.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Videos from the party showed guests dancing close together without masks and ignoring social distancing.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The surprise bash for Bolt was thrown by his girlfriend model Kasi Bennett.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Man City star <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/raheem-sterling/\">Sterling</a> had been expected to be named in Gareth Southgate’s England squad today for the upcoming games against Iceland and Denmark.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Footage from <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/usain-bolt/\">Bolt’s</a> birthday ‘brunch’, which took place on Friday, showed him washing his hands and face with champagne.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A source said: “Like anything featuring Usain Bolt, it was a pretty flashy party with lots of guests and minimal mask wearing.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Guests were joking about partying until midnight – despite an 11pm Covid-19 curfew – and were laughing about the possibility of the police coming to break it up.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Bolt later confirmed in a video posted to social media that he was in Covid-19 isolation.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t<blockquote class=\"article__quote\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article__quote-copy theme__before-color theme__after-color\">\n\t\t\t<p>Like anything featuring Usain Bolt, it was a pretty flashy party with lots of guests and minimal mask wearing.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</blockquote>\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>The former athlete, who appeared to be sweating in the video, insisted he had no symptoms and said: “Just waking up like everybody else, check social media.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I saw that social media saying I’m confirmed to have Covid-19.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I did a test on Saturday to leave ‘cos I work. I’m trying to be responsible so I am going to stay in and stay here for my friends.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I’m also having no symptoms so I’m going to quarantine myself and wait on the confirmation to see what is the protocol and how shall I go about quarantining myself.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Until then, I&#8217;m quarantined by myself and just taking it easy. Be safe out there.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The footballer has reportedly tested negative for Covid-19 after a source close to Sterling said: “Raheem feels fine and is showing no <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronavirus/\">Covid-19</a> symptoms.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sterling will have to pass another Covid-19 test before he is allowed to join up with the other players. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 25-man squad is due to meet up from Sunday before going into a protective “bubble” for the games.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A source said: “It’s a real headache for Gareth. Raheem’s a key player but he’s now relying on medical experts to ensure there’s a safe way for him to join the squad.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container League quarter-final. He spends each summer on the island seeing friends and family.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Jamaica has had 1,529 coronavirus cases and 16 deaths. But after just 174 cases in July, there have been 267 in the past four days.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491504\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 438px\"><img ate":1598353584691},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Antonio Conte could leave Inter Milan TODAY after ‘day of truth’ meeting as ex-Juventus boss Allegri waits to take over","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12491571/antonio-conte-leave-inter-today-allegri/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>ANTONIO CONTE could leave Inter Milan TODAY after a &#8220;day of truth&#8221; meeting &#8211; with former Juventus boss Massimiliano Allegri poised to take over.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The former Chelsea manager, 51, will meet president Steven Zhang to hold clear-the-air talks. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491753\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/b8cac5f8-f61e-4cf5-8d40-42e7e113151a.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491753\" width=\"960\" height=\"661\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Conte and Zhang are set to spend Tuesday locked in talks about the boss&#8217; future[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491676\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000491368643.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491676\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>EPA</figcredit></figure>Massimiliano Allegri is being lined up to replace Antonio Conte[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/antonio-conte/\">Conte</a> clashed with the board all season having failed to win any silverware in 2019-20.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He famously <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12300031/antonio-conte-inter-milan-future-doubts/\">lost his rag and attacked Zhang and Co</a> after missing out on the Serie A title &#8211; claiming his players deserved more protection and recognition.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Italian even hinted he would quit after their <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12468389/sevilla-3-inter-milan-2-europa-league-final-lukaku-own-goal/\">Europa League final loss to Sevilla</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Inter/24-08-2020/inter-zhang-vede-conte-giorno-verita-3801413567646.shtml\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Gazzetta dello Sport</a> have now claimed Conte is set for a day of talks with the board as they line up former Juve chief Allegri to take his place.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Following last Friday&#8217;s loss, Conte &#8211; whose stress has been compounded after being <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12488053/antonio-conte-recover-27m-scammer/\">scammed out of £27million</a> &#8211; hinted at quitting.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>&#8216;EVERYTHING HAS ITS LIMITS&#8217;</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>He claimed: &#8220;It has been difficult and we&#8217;ll figure things out.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It has been wonderful for me to be the coach of <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1302935/inter-milan/\">Inter</a>, I thank the owners who allowed me to go through this great experience.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;If some situations end up affecting my family, that is no longer enough for me.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Everything has its limits, I have to see where my limits are.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491677\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603344109.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491677\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>Antonio Conte hinted at quitting after the Europa League final loss[/caption]\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We’ll clarify the situation, without rancour.&#160;Something happened, there&#8217;s no point beating around the bush.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We have to see whether everyone is prepared to not have another year like this for what happened with me.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;There are a few situations I will evaluate, it&#8217;s only right the president evaluates it too&#8230; I&#8217;ll tell the directors my views.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Immediately after the thrilling 3-2 loss to Sevilla, Zhang gave his vote of confidence to Conte ahead of their showdown talks.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Zhang claimed: &#8220;The evaluation is good. Our path has allowed us to get to a final and play in a historic match.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We are playing really well, winning or losing is part of football but we came to the final full of confidence.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We will rest, that&#8217;s what the players and the staff deserve.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;In the coming weeks and months we will talk about the future but what is certain is that we want to improve.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It hasn&#8217;t worked out this time, but we&#8217;ll try again next year.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;That&#8217;s the beauty of sport &#8211; to try your best and try to improve.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: -->\n\n\t\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 09:15:24 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/b8cac5f8-f61e-4cf5-8d40-42e7e113151a.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"af49c3cbc9ab8c4d2a13d0409040d69a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-25-137_714e9ac0c2d9b40c.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":661,"sourceBytes":60300,"destBytes":60300,"author":"Dave Fraser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/b8cac5f8-f61e-4cf5-8d40-42e7e113151a.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-25-137_714e9ac0c2d9b40c.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000491368643.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn17@2020_3/2020/08/25/11-06-42-367_7ac9abbeca7b5080.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603344109.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn82@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-44-900_511679e85fa23873.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584717},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Quarter of bosses have employed relatives in recent months sparking revival of traditional family businesses","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12491298/business-owners-relatives-quarter-bosses-recruitment/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>ALMOST a quarter of business owners have employed relatives in recent months – sparking a revival of traditional family businesses.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The study of 500 small business owners found that of the 23 per cent who took on a family member, 46 per cent hired their partner, while 55 per cent recruited a sibling.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491630\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604002183.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491630\" width=\"960\" height=\"552\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>A study found that of the 23 per cent of businesses who took on a family member, 46 per cent hired their partner, while 55 per cent recruited a sibling[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>And one in 10 even asked for help from their in-laws.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Almost half (46 per cent) employed relatives during lockdown because they needed extra help, while 34 per cent felt their loved ones had the skills they were looking for.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Other reasons included the family member wanting to gain work experience or because they were struggling to find work after finishing education during the pandemic.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The research, commissioned by Funding Circle, found the family employment typically lasted seven weeks, but 68 per cent still have their relative working for them.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And while 21 per cent are considering taking them on full time following this experience, 45 per cent would look at hiring more relatives in the future.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It also emerged that as a result of this, more than a fifth would like to see more traditional family businesses making a comeback.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Lisa Jacobs, Funding Circle&#8217;s UK managing director, said: &#8220;Family sits at the heart of many successful small businesses.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;One of the silver linings of this crisis might be a revival of the traditional family business, with relatives spending more time together as business colleagues and partners as well as at home.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>HARD WORKERS</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>The research also found more than a third of small business owners admitted their relative worked harder than they expected them to.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>More than a quarter said their relative’s working attitude was respectful and 22 per cent said they seemed enthusiastic.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Similarly, 32 per cent of owners said working with their relation was fun and 30 per cent felt it was motivating, yet 12 per cent described it as difficult at times.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And although 31 per cent of those polled said taking on their loved one was positive for their family relationship, three in 10 struggled to be ‘boss’ to them.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>When it came to family perks, 41 per cent of bosses admitted they gave their family member flexible hours, 24 per cent offered longer breaks and 30 per cent even gave them a free lunch.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The findings come after a separate study of 1,500 relatives of small business owners found that of the 23 per cent who were taken on by their family, a third found it motivating.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Popular family businesses were found to fall into the sectors of retail, business, consulting and management, and creative arts and design.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And for 62 per cent of ‘employees’ the new role with their relative was something completely different to their usual job.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>For a fifth, their new ‘boss’ was their dad, while a tenth had their mum to answer to and 14 per cent were ‘hired’ by their uncle.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>More than a third even said the experience has made them want to be more involved with the family business and 31 per cent feel encouraged to start their own company.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But 44 per cent admitted they now realise how much work goes into running a business, according to the OnePoll figures.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>More than a quarter found themselves helping out a relative because they were on furlough, while 28 per cent had always had an interest in it and now had the time.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Positives of working for a family member included being able to act completely themselves (35 per cent), spending more time with family (40 per cent) and feeling less pressure (30 per cent).</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div moment man is sent somersaulting over hedge by &#039;road rage driver&#039;\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Professor Alfredo de Massis, a family business expert from the Free University of Bolzano and Lancaster University, added: “The results emphasise the crucial importance of family involvement in business during particularly challenging times.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“My own recent research into 3,500 firms from all over the world showed that family firms have been more resilient than their nonfamily counterparts during the pandemic and lockdown.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“The reasons behind this have to be found in their long-term orientation, family-centred non-economic goals and strong values handed over across generations.” +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604002183.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"c106fbb7d0ec3e1e1f605812856411b4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn98@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-27-194_e1d4a6844da81ad7.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":552,"sourceBytes":229680,"destBytes":229680,"author":"Ben 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Khabib vs Georges St-Pierre fight a ‘big possibility’ after Gaethje at UFC 254, says Russian star’s coach","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/mma/12492362/khabib-gsp-ufc-fight-retirement/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>GEORGES ST-PIERRE is &#8220;a big possibility&#8221; for Khabib Nurmagomedov&#8217;s final fight in MMA.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Russian brawler is preparing to take on Justin Gaethje at UFC 254 before a possible final fight to claim a 30-0 record.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492744\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/65890344-e509-48c4-b3c3-094ed0657653.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492744\" width=\"960\" height=\"680\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Khabib Nurmagomedov wants to hang up his gloves with a perfect 30-0 record[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492724\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000578448391-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492724\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Georges St-Pierre is in contention for the mega fight next year[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>If Gaethje is dispatched in October, Khabib will be one win away from a perfect career record that coach Javier Mendez believes is the 31-year-old&#8217;s ultimate goal.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>On a match-up between the legendary pair, the American Kickboxing Academy founder told <a href=\"https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/2020/08/hablemos-mma-5-entrevista-con-javier-mendez-resumen-de-ufc-on-espn-15-bellator-244-y-mas\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">MMAJunkie</a>: “Yeah, it’s a big possibility. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;He might do that because all the times that I was with him and his dad, they’ve talked about those things: two more fights, 30-0.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“They want a legacy fight, then be done and help the other guys that are starting their fighting careers. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;There’s great fighters, cousins of his who are great fighter like Umar and Usman Nurmagomedov. They’re his blood. They’re going to be great fighters. Islam Makhachev too.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“So he wants to help them get to the title. I don’t think he’ll fight beyond that, but anything is possible. </p>\n\n\n\n<script type=\"application/javascript\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/pollingwidgets/v3/widget.js?question_id=2877&#038;game=polling\"></script>\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DD-COMPOSITE-UFC-PPV-2.jpg\"><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-11614260 size-thesun-article-image\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DD-COMPOSITE-UFC-PPV-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\"></a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I was a fighter too and when you’re finishing a career, you feel it in your heart, you want to fight more and it’s hard not to fight. I don’t think he’ll continue fighting, but anything is possible.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He added: &#8220;The person that beats GSP will be the best of all time.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>St. Pierre, 39, last fought in 2017 having earned his iconic status with a string of ten consecutive Welterweight Championship wins a decade ago.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But the Canadian recently <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12467817/ufc-georges-st-pierre-body-khabib-fight/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">showed how he is keeping in tip-top condition</a> for a potential return to the octagon.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t<blockquote class=\"article__quote\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article__quote-copy theme__before-color theme__after-color\">\n\t\t\t<p>As for GSP, this fight motivates me very much. It was the dream fight of my father.</p>\n\t\t\t\t<cite class=\"article__quote-credit theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"quote-credit\">Khabib</span>\t\t\t\t</cite>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t</blockquote>\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-sport\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">latest mma news</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Many fans want to see Khabib cap off his career with a rematch against Conor McGregor yet he has already indicated <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/mma/12410269/khabib-gsp-mcgregor-white-fight-ufc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">his desire for a meeting with GSP</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking of how the fight would fulfill a dream of his late father, the Russian said: &#8220;If I beat Gaethje in October and we fight Georges St-Pierre before Ramadan, that would be awesome. We will see.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Dana White told me that after my fight with Gaethje the UFC will negotiate with Georges St-Pierre.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;If Georges St-Pierre says yes, then the fight will happen. The UFC and me, we are interested.”</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ac-table-sport-big-upcoming-ufc-fights.jpg\"><img Mayo","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/65890344-e509-48c4-b3c3-094ed0657653.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn54@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-25-552_d4275513c31f92ad.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000578448391-1.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn24@2020_2/2020/08/25/11-06-30-932_a1bacffc85234a7b.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DD-COMPOSITE-UFC-PPV-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn93@2020_3/2020/08/25/11-06-38-264_01f7009f35502df3.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ac-table-sport-big-upcoming-ufc-fights.jpg?strip=all&w=950":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn91@2020_3/2020/08/25/11-06-33-445_9a35f0a0c67004f6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584675},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"When will quarantine be lifted in France, Spain and Portugal?","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12443699/france-spain-portugal-quarantine-travel-coronavirus/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>FRANCE and Spain are still on the UK government&#8217;s quarantine list as new coronavirus infections fail to drop.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, British holidaymakers can visit Portugal now without having to self-isolate for 14 days after it was removed from the quarantine list last week.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12444517\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602295926-4.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12444517\" width=\"960\" height=\"625\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AFP - Getty</figcredit></figure>Brits can now freely visit Portugal for a summer break[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>When was Portugal removed from the UK quarantine list?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Good news for British holidaymakers &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12447947/croatia-uk-quarantine-list-holiday-portugal/\">Portugal has been taken off the quarantine list</a> from August 21.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Iberian country had been placed on the list immediately following the air bridge announcement in July due to a spike in cases in Lisbon.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/portugal/\">Portugal&#8217;s</a> infection rate has reduced with just 123 new cases yesterday &#8211; meaning Brits can now head for a late summer break with a raft of <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12461366/portugal-holidays-cheap-deals-flights-algarve/\">top holiday and flight deals</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Portuguese islands of Madeira and the Azores had not been on the advisory list.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12444125\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3ae1edb1-5d24-45bd-a31c-62b03bf5dfb6.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12444125\" width=\"960\" height=\"660\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Portugal has been removed from the UK&#8217;s quarantine list[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>When will Spain be removed from the UK quarantine list?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/spain/\">Spain</a> is unlikely to be removed from the UK quarantine list any time soon, as cases continue to climb in number.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Spain&#8217;s total coronavirus infections of 420,809 has been steadily rising since July, when tourists were welcomed back to the country including Brits.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>On August 22, new daily infections hit 6,900 &#8211; the highest since March 26.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Most cases in the new outbreak have been discovered in Catalonia and the capital Madrid.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Until infections begin to reduce, the country won&#8217;t be removed from the quarantine list.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The travel ban includes the Canary Islands and the Balearic Islands as well, who have been enforcing a number of new coronavirus restrictions to slow the spread of the virus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Public smoking has been banned, along with pool parties, and some beaches and bars now have curfews in place &#8211; hotels and bars are closing altogether in some destinations such as Majorca.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12444110\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602141337.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12444110\" width=\"960\" height=\"627\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AFP - DPA</figcredit></figure>Spain has been trying to contain the latest outbreak of coronavirus[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12444079\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602503873.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12444079\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy Live News</figcredit></figure>Masks, curfews and smoking bans are in place across Spain right now[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>When will France be removed from the UK quarantine list?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/france/\">France</a> is among the most recent countries to be placed on the quarantine list.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Total cases have hit 244,854 while new daily cases have spiked as high as 4,897 on August 23, the highest since mid-April.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The country was added along with Malta and the Netherlands on August 15, leading to a rush of tourists attempting to return to the UK before it was enforced at 4am.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Discussions for the country being removed from the travel ban list are unlikely to happen any time soon, as cases rise and it still being deemed a risky country.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Brits who need to return home from other countries through France, only if they <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12431964/france-holiday-travel-loophole-quarantine-eurotunnel/\">use the Eurotunnel</a> and drive through France without leaving their car.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>France may <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12484773/france-quarantine-rules-uk-holiday/\">reciprocate the UK&#8217;s quarantine restrictions</a> on Brits in the next few days, forcing arrivals to self-isolate for two weeks.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div places to be added to the quarantine list, after cases rose in the holiday hotspots.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/turkey/\">Turkey</a> and <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/greece/\">Greece</a> remain on the safe list due to their low daily infections per 100,000 population, despite fears they could face quarantine restrictions.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The government is being urged to look at alternatives to the two-week quarantine, such as a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12429279/ditch-14-day-quarantine-five-day-iceland-model-call/\">five-day model used by Iceland.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p><a £36m","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12491980/leeds-valencia-transfer-rodrigo-moreno/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>LEEDS UNITED are reportedly on the verge of beating Arsenal in the transfer chase for Valencia star Rodrigo Moreno.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The striker was believed to be valued at £50million this summer but the newly-promoted Yorkshire side have bargained his fee down to £36m.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492531\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6dadadb2-fccd-4da2-9a9c-0afdba46f7bf.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492531\" width=\"960\" height=\"634\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty </figcredit></figure>Leeds are reportedly on the verge of signing Valencia star Rodrigo Moreno[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Now <a href=\"https://as.com/futbol/2020/08/25/primera/1598341439_324941.amp.html?id_externo_rsoc=comp_tw&#38;__twitter_impression=true\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Diario AS</a> claims <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1225859/leeds-united/\">Leeds</a>’ owner and chairman Andrea Radrizzani and director of football Victor Orta are both in Valencia to wrap up the move.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 29-year-old has caught the eye in <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/la-liga/\">LaLiga</a> and has fired in 59 goals for the Spanish side during his six years there.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He was linked with a switch to Barcelona earlier this year before the Nou Camp outfit opted <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/11271390/barcelona-looking-to-sell-martin-braithwaite/\">to move for Martin Braithwaite</a> instead.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Now Rodrigo could be lining up for Leeds in the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/premierleague/\">Premier League</a> instead despite the Gunners also being keen.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Marcelo Bielsa is desperate to bolster his attack ahead of their return to the top-flight following a 16-year absence.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And it appears that the Brazil-born Spain international is the man he wants to lead his forward line.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As well as playing in a traditional No9 role, Rodrigo is equally at home playing on the wing.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Valencia have been forced to put their entire squad up for sale due to the financial difficulties caused by the coronavirus pandemic.</p>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"wp-block-group\"><div class=\"wp-block-group__inner-container\">\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" gossip and the biggest deals</a></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n</div></div>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Now those money problems could be eased if Leeds complete the deal.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Former Real Madrid youth player Rodrigo already has experience in England.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He was signed by Bolton back in 2010 but failed to shine for the Trotters during his one-year loan spell from Benfica.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The ace scored just once in 17 appearances before heading back to Portugal but after a successful loan period with Valencia, they made it a permanent arrangement in 2015.</p>\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/LB-AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Most-Valuable-Players-ARTICLE.jpg\"><img class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-11813314\" height=\"753\"></a></p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 10:14:24 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6dadadb2-fccd-4da2-9a9c-0afdba46f7bf.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"9bc10f1fdeae0040071e4256c03bac92","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn57@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-078_823a6c7956cf3584.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":634,"sourceBytes":110622,"destBytes":110622,"author":"Gary Stonehouse","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6dadadb2-fccd-4da2-9a9c-0afdba46f7bf.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn57@2020_5/2020/08/25/11-06-25-078_823a6c7956cf3584.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/LB-AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Most-Valuable-Players-ARTICLE.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn71@2020_6/2020/08/25/11-06-31-407_ced5f810e327c3f3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584756},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Rule Britannia! subtitles should be put on BBC Proms so patriotic Brits can sing along after ban","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/politics/12491742/bbc-proms-rule-britannia-subtitles-row/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>SUBTITLES should be put on the BBC&#8217;s proms so patriotic Brits can sing along to Rule Britannia! and Land of Hope and Glory, a Cabinet minister said today.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Business secretary Alok Sharma told Times Radio that he thought the BBC could put subtitles on the screen for Last Night of the Proms so people could sing along at home.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"⚠\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &#38; updates</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491876\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603859938-2-3.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491876\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The Beeb is facing calls to pub the subtitles on for the famous bash next month</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>It comes after the Beeb faced fury for axing the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12489411/bbc-ban-words-land-of-hope-and-glory-proms/\">singing at the bash, which will take place next month.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Beeb bosses instead announced they would feature — but only as orchestral versions amid fears of a backlash from <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/black-lives-matter/\">Black Lives Matter</a> campaigners due to lyrical connotations about the British Empire.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The annual Royal Albert Hall concert, beamed around the world, traditionally ends with the&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/uknews/12476359/rule-britannia-land-hope-glory-black-lives-matter-bbc-proms/\">flag-waving anthems</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But organisers were said to be concerned about their links to the British Empire, and lyrics including: “Britons never will be slaves.”&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One BBC source described the handling of the line-up as “white guys in a panic,” trying to appease the movement.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Government had expressed its displeasure with the move.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Culture Sec Oliver Dowden told the BBC that “confident, forward-looking nations don’t erase their history”.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Boris Johnson said that while he understands the emotions involved, “we need to tackle the substance of problems, not the symbols”.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And this morning Mr Sharma said, &#8220;I think the Last Night of the Proms brings a huge amount of pleasure to millions of people.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I personally think it&#8217;s a very joyful occasion, I think it will be quite strange without a live audience there. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We&#8217;ve heard the BBC&#8217;s position that they will maintain the traditions. Personally I would like to see the lyrics sung and of course it is always possible to put lyrics up as subtitles on the screen so if people want to they can join in at home.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It came as leader Sir Keir Starmer has weighed into the BBC Proms row defending the “pomp and pageantry” as “a staple of British summer.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Asked if he backed the move to censor the words to Rule Britannia, a Labour spokesman said “enjoying patriotic songs does not &#8211; and should not &#8211; present a barrier to examining our past and learning lessons from it.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But they stopped short if demanding a uturn, insisting the running order was a matter for the organisers. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The spokesperson said: &#8220;The running order is a matter for organisers &#38; the BBC, but enjoying patriotic songs does not&#8230; present a barrier to examining our past.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Labour&#8217;s Lord Adonis said today: “It’s part of being English, I don’t understand what the problem is. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It seems almost laughable to think we are going to start censoring some of these great national songs. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;What are they going to next, the national anthem? It’s ridiculous this whole thing.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Labour’s catastrophic election defeat last year was partly down to the party’s ‘patriotism problem’.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Party insiders said furious voters repeatedly raised the issue on the doorstep.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sir Keir Starmer had promised to change all that and called for the party to finally embrace patriotism.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking in April this year, he said:&#160;“I’m really proud of my country and I wouldn’t be leader of the Labour party if I wasn’t patriotic.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#160;“What I desperately want for our country is for our country to get better. In the Labour party we should be proud of being patriotic.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“We’re all working, knocking on doors in the rain or shine, to try to put in place a team that can go into government to improve the country we live in because we love the country we live in.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I don’t think we should shy away from that. That is a really good thing to be proud of, and to want your country to be the best it possibly can be.”</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Land of Hope and Glory lyrics</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p>Land of Hope and Glory</p>\n<p>Mother of the Free</p>\n<p>How shall we extol thee</p>\n<p>Who are born of thee?</p>\n<p>Wider still, and wider</p>\n<p>Shall thy bounds be set;</p>\n<p>God, who made thee mighty</p>\n<p>Make thee mightier yet!</p>\n<p>Dear Land of Hope, thy hope is crowned</p>\n<p>God make thee mightier yet!</p>\n<p>On Sov&#8217;ran brows, beloved, renowned</p>\n<p>Once more thy crown is set</p>\n<p>Thine equal laws, by Freedom gained</p>\n<p>Have ruled thee well and long;</p>\n<p>By Freedom gained, by Truth maintained</p>\n<p>Thine Empire shall be strong</p>\n<p>Thy fame is ancient as the days</p>\n<p>As Ocean large and wide: A pride that dares, and heeds not praise</p>\n<p>A stern and silent pride</p>\n<p>Not that false joy that dreams content</p>\n<p>With what our sires have won;</p>\n<p>The blood a hero sire hath spent</p>\n<p>Still nerves a hero son</p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col moment man is sent somersaulting over hedge by &#039;road rage driver&#039;\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Debating the issue on Good Morning Britain, freedom of speech campaigner Inaya Folarin Iman said criticism of the two songs was &#8220;absurd&#8221;, adding that they bring &#8220;a lot of people joy and happiness&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But Kehinde Andrews, a black studies professor at Birmingham City University, said the line &#8220;Britons never, never, never shall be slaves&#8221; from Rule Britannia is racist propaganda dating back to the British Empire.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Rule Britannia! lyrics</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p>Rule, Britannia! Britannia, rule the waves!</p>\n<p>Britons never, never, never shall be slaves.</p>\n<p>When Britain first, at heaven&#8217;s command,</p>\n<p>Arose from out the azure main,</p>\n<p>This was the charter of the land,</p>\n<p>And Guardian Angels sang this strain:</p>\n<p>The nations not so blest as thee</p>\n<p>Must, in their turn, to tyrants fall,</p>\n<p>While thou shalt flourish great and free:</p>\n<p>The dread and envy of them all.</p>\n<p>Still more majestic shalt thou rise,</p>\n<p>More dreadful from each foreign stroke,</p>\n<p>As the loud blast that tears the skies</p>\n<p>Serves but to root thy native oak.</p>\n<p>Thee haughty tyrants ne&#8217;er shall tame;</p>\n<p>All their attempts to bend thee down</p>\n<p>Will but arouse thy generous flame,</p>\n<p>But work their woe and thy renown.</p>\n<p>To thee belongs the rural reign;</p>\n<p>Thy cities shall with commerce shine;</p>\n<p>All thine shall be the subject main,</p>\n<p>And every shore it circles, thine.</p>\n<p>The Muses, still with freedom found,</p>\n<p>Shall to thy happy coasts repair.</p>\n<p>Blest isle! with matchless beauty crowned,</p>\n<p>And manly hearts to guard the fair.</p>\n<p>Rule, Britannia! Britannia, rule the waves!</p>\n<p>Britons never, never, never shall be slaves</p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: interest","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12491610/roma-chris-smalling-transfer-man-utd/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>ROMA are ready to come back in with an offer of £14.5million for Chris Smalling, according to reports.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>With the centre-back described as <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12410866/man-utd-smalling-roma-newcastle/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">keen to extend his stay in the Italian capital</a>, coach Paulo Fonseca and new Lupi owner Dan Friedkin want to match his ambition.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12492044\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12492032.jpg?strip=all\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone wp-image-12492044\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Chris Smalling has a number of options on the table after a strong spell in Rome[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>And Roma will therefore &#8220;throw everything&#8221; they have at a permanent deal for Smalling, according to Italian newspaper Il Tempo via <a href=\"http://sportwitness.co.uk/club-ready-throw-everything-man-united-player-new-intermediary-want-done-e16-17m/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">Sport Witness</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>SunSport understand that a £20m price tag <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12391017/man-utd-chris-smalling-transfer-roma/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">has been set by United</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>With the gap in valuations, Roma are said to be heavily relying on the player&#8217;s desire to push through a deal.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A new agent has also been employed to negotiate with the Old Trafford giants.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Smalling excelled in Serie A last season, fondly dubbed &#8216;Smaldini&#8217; by fans as he reignited his career in 37 appearances.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Should Roma not become a feasible option for next season, a spot in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer&#8217;s squad is not out of the question.</p>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><strong><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12390714/man-utd-transfer-news-live-jadon-sancho-dembele-pogba/\">MAN UTD NEWS returned to UFC to face him.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 33-year-old relinquished his light-heavyweight title last week as he eyes a move up to the heavyweight division.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12491047\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000583155268.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602920006.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12491048\" width=\"640\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images </figcredit></figure>Bones looks set to step up to the UFC heavyweight division[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Both Francis Ngannou and UFC heavyweight champ Stipe Miocic have been touted as potential opponents for Bones.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, former title holder <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/brock-lesnar/\">Lesnar</a> also wants to fight Jones, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/9758420/ufc-wwe-brock-lesnar-jon-jones-kurt-angle/\">according to fellow WWE legend Kurt Angle</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But the ever-confident Jones believes The Beast Incarnate would provide him with any problems whatsoever.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Angle had previously said: “I know he said that he&#8217;s retired.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“The one fight he wants, and I don&#8217;t know if it&#8217;s ever going to happen, but he wants to go up against <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/jon-jones/\">Jon Jones</a>.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<script type=\"application/javascript\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/pollingwidgets/v3/widget.js?question_id=2875&#038;game=polling\"></script>\n\n\n\n<p>Reacting to those comments, Jones responded with: “He knows that&#8217;s what his friends want to hear, but he doesn&#8217;t really want this fight. Trust me.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Brock is way too slow, I&#8217;ll embarrass him.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Lesnar last fought inside the octagon back at UFC 200 in July 2016.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Meanwhile <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/10925175/ufc-247-jon-jones-result/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CBones%E2%80%9D%20sealed%20his%2014th%20championship,Houston%2C%20Texas%20on%20Sunday%20morning.&#38;text=The%2032%2Dyear%2Dold%20was,from%20Reyes%20at%20UFC%20247.\">Jones controversially defended his belt last time out against Dominick Reyes at UFC 247</a> in February.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>UFC president Dana White was recently quizzed on the prospect of Jones getting an instant championship shot at Miocic in the heavyweight division.</p>\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-JONES-V-LESNER.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>He said:”[Jon Jones is] the longtime light heavyweight champion.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“In my opinion, he&#8217;s the greatest of all time, and if he wants to come back and take a shot at the heavyweight championship, I wouldn&#8217;t have a problem with that.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“But he can&#8217;t just jump in front of Ngannou right now.”</p>\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DD-COMPOSITE-UFC-PPV-2.jpg\"><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-11614260 size-thesun-article-image\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DD-COMPOSITE-UFC-PPV-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\"></a></p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 08:39:54 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000583155268.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"d696711a20462c07cf3d791696a1ed5a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn39@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-25-077_1ae679bd66a32004.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":639,"sourceBytes":43184,"destBytes":43184,"author":"Gary Stonehouse","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000583155268.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn39@2020_4/2020/08/25/11-06-25-077_1ae679bd66a32004.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602920006.jpg?strip=all&w=640":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn91@2020_3/2020/08/25/11-06-30-727_55b4ff06bfb3c2ea.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-JONES-V-LESNER.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn31@2020_3/2020/08/25/11-06-32-984_6f7d4e53c25aa14f.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DD-COMPOSITE-UFC-PPV-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn93@2020_3/2020/08/25/11-06-38-264_01f7009f35502df3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598353584752},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 19:06:24","title":"Fortnite to stay BANNED after judge rules that Apple can blacklist hit iPhone game","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12491762/fortnite-banned-iphone-apple-lawsuit/","description":"<p>FORTNITE will stay banned on Apple devices for the foreseeable future, a judge has ruled.</p> \n<p>Epic Games tried to overturn the game’s ban on iPhones and iPads – but was denied in courts.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12492102\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-64.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492102\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Alamy\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Apple and Google have blocked Fortnite from their app stores indefinitely[/caption] \n<p>It comes just over a week after Apple removed Fortnite from its App Store for breaking the rules.</p> \n<p>Apple takes a 30% cut of money earned by apps through the App Store – and Epic Games tried to dodge this fee.</p> \n<p>Both firms are now embroiled in a legal dispute over the ban.</p> \n<p>US District Court Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers said Apple was fine to ban Fortnite.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12492103\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-65.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492103\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Alamy\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Apple and Google cited a direct payment feature rolled out on the Fortnite app as the violation[/caption] \n<p>But the judge ruled that Apple couldn’t block Epic Games’ developer accounts.</p> \n<p>The judge also said Apple couldn’t prevent developers from using Epic Games’ very popular Unreal Engine – a tool used to make video games.</p> \n<p>“The record shows potential significant damage to both the Unreal Engine platform itself, and to the gaming industry generally, including on both third-party developers and gamers,” the judge warned.</p> \n<p>“Apple has chosen to act severely, and by doing so, has impacted non-parties, and a third-party developer ecosystem.”</p> \n<p>Epic Games will now have to comply with the App Store rules, or live with Fortnite being permanently banned from the iPhone.</p> \n<p>As part of an ongoing PR war, Epic Games recently <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12463977/fortnite-free-cup-anti-apple-prizes-how-to-compete-weekend/\">held a #FreeFortnite tournament</a> with “anti-Apple” prizes – including Samsung gadgets.</p> \n<p>Apple and rival tech giant Google have come under fire in recent years for operating alleged “monopolies” in which they stifle competition and take colossal&nbsp;cuts on sales made through their app stores.</p> \n<p>“Apple has become what it once railed against: The behemoth seeking to control markets, block competition, and stifle innovation,” Epic said in its lawsuit against Apple, filed in the Northern District of California.</p> \n<p>“Apple is bigger, more powerful, more entrenched, and more pernicious than the monopolists of yesteryear.”</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12492164\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-66.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492164\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Epic Games\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Fortnite is waging a PR war against Apple[/caption] \n<p>In a separate lawsuit against Google, Epic referenced the company’s now-infamous mantra, “Don’t Be Evil”.</p> \n<p>“Twenty-two years later, Google has relegated its motto to nearly an afterthought.”</p> \n<p>Epic also attacked Apple on social media, launching a campaign with the hashtag #FreeFortnite.</p> \n<p>The company urged players to seek refunds from Apple if they lost access to the game, and created a parody of Apple’s famous “1984” television ad.</p> \n<p>In the parody, which quickly garnered hundreds of thousands of views, a female Fortnite fighter hurls a unicorn-shaped club to smash a screen on which an Apple-headed character speaks of “the anniversary of the platform unification directives.”</p> \n<p>Apple takes a cut of between 15 and 30 per cent for most app subscriptions and payments made inside apps.</p> \n<p>There are some exceptions for companies that already have a credit card on file for iPhone customers if they also offer an in-app payment that would benefit Apple.</p> \n<p>Analysts believe games are the biggest contributor to spending inside the App Store, which is in turn the largest component of Apple’s $46billion-per-year (£35billion) services segment.</p> \n<p>In a statement, Apple said Fortnite was removed because Epic had launched the payment feature with the “express intent of violating the App Store guidelines” after having had apps in the store for a decade.</p> \n<p>“The fact that their (Epic) business interests now lead them to push for a special arrangement does not change the fact that these guidelines create a level playing field for all developers and make the store safe for all users,” Apple said.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12492171\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-186.png?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12492171\" width=\"960\" height=\"384\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  The Sun / eBay\n </figcredit>\n</figure>iPhones with Fortnite still installed are being sold for thousands on eBay[/caption] \n<p>Google also removed Fortnite from its Play Store, but the company’s spokesman Dan Jackson declined to comment on the lawsuit when contacted by Reuters.</p> \n<p>“However, we welcome the opportunity to continue our discussions with Epic and bring Fortnite back to Google Play,” he said in a statement.</p> \n<p>The recent ban means it’s impossible to download Fortnite through the official Apple and Google stores.</p> \n<p>However, handsets with Fortnite still installed are&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12421588/iphone-fortnite-for-sale-online-sold-money-price-account-installed/https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12421588/iphone-fortnite-for-sale-online-sold-money-price-account-installed/\">being sold for thousands of pounds</a>&nbsp;online.</p> \n<p>Most of the listings fall somewhere between $2,000 and $7,000.</p> \n<p>That’s far above the typical price of a used iPhone, which could range from just a few hundred pounds to slightly north of $1,000, depending on the model.</p> \n<p>It seems few “Fortnite handsets” are actually selling at these vastly inflated prices.</p> \n<p>But The Sun has seen a “completed listing” – which means the product has sold and shipped – for $3,800 in the US.</p> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; </div>\n <!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>In other news, a Mum&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12369317/distraught-mum-gets-20000-refund-twitch-fortnite-streamers/\">was left devastated</a>&nbsp;after her Fortnite addict son splashed $20,000 on Twitch live-streamers.</p> \n<p>Samsung’s new Note 20 smartphone comes with Xbox games as part of its&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12319369/samsung-galaxy-note-20-xbox-controller-games-pass/\">bid to topple Apple’s iPhone</a>.</p> \n<p>Microsoft will launch&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12361483/xbox-controller-leak-second-new-series-x-s-console/\">a second new console</a>&nbsp;later this year dubbed the Xbox Series S, photos leaked online suggest.</p> \n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" /> \n<p><strong>We pay for your stories!
